review_title: Is Bruce Willis that hard up for cash?
review_detailed_main: "Die Hard in Space" this is not. Truly a terrible, terrible movie. I'm embarrassed for Bruce

2 minutes in, something felt wrong, I'd pressed play because I like Sci-fi and I like Bruce. At 24 minutes I came here to make sure I wasn't alone in thinking, what the actual F.

I think the BBC must have found the old sets for Red Dwarf and sold them to these guys because everything looks super cheap and the special effects are comical. The plot makes no sense, the characters make no sense, the acting is insanely bad. As a little side side point, why the hell would you have a cleaning product on a spaceship that if not diluted can literally eat through metal?

Sometimes really bad can still be fun, this is not one of those times.

How come they got all these actors together and paid them? Probably thats where most of the movie budget went...B- movie with A-list actors. The sets in the movie are hilarious, the dialogue is just not right, the editing seems incomplete and the camera shots are weird enough and repetitive. It 's a 3-star movie just because the story is not that bad and literally 3 scenes of the movie are good. But i can't recommend this to anyone with a taste in sci-fi. Watch Pandorum instead or re-watch another sci-fi and avoid the disappointment. 3/10

review_title: A CHEAP 'N' CHEESY B-MOVIE BUT I LIKED IT!!!
review_detailed_main:
ANTI-LIFE is a very low-budget DTV B-movie in the Sci-fi Thriller Genre & starring ex-A lister BRUCE WILLIS & it's in my opinion fairly good fun!!!

Now this is extremely low-quality & looks like a t.v series in it's overall look but i dig it's Cult Classic influences such as John Carpenter's The Thing, Prince of Darkness & Ghost's of Mars as well as Alien & other Sci-fi flicks & that gives it the old skool comforting charm as we feel like we've seen all this before because we have & it's definitely a comfort having Willis aboard this sci-fi Adventure as we all grew up watching the guy, he is an old skool Action legend.

Set during Earth's last days as an inhabitable planet the last remaining humans in the hundred-thousands, are rushed aboard a huge space ship thats going deep into space to a new planet to start fresh & i think we as humans let are planet die because like in real life no one looks after our planet & only care about money so the story as a fantasy does have a ring of truth to it. The huge space ship puts everyone to sleep until they reach their new destination in about 6 months or so except a team of workers stay awake to make sure everything stays safe during the long journey & here we have our rugged team with the old A-hole veteran Bruce Willis as Clay & his new team mate played by Cody Kearsley (Riverdale) a maintenance/Cleaner & Johnny Messner (Sabotage) & a few other recognisable faces amongst the skeleton Crew & the leader/Captain of the ship the great B-movie legend THOMAS JANE (Deep Blue Sea, The Mist, The Predator, Nemesis, The Punisher) I'm a big Jane fan & even though he has basically a glorified Cameo it's better for the film that he's in it!!! Bruce Willis starts out as a big A-hole with a drinking problem & a bad attitude but as the film goes along he's the Willis we know & love. This Crew are up against an Alien creature that gets aboard the ship & starts to infect the workers & does all kinds of bloody & gross stuff & gradually are small crew have to gear up & fight this thing in an "ALIEN" kind of way & it's pretty fun B-movie stuff.

The effects are very poor & thats due to the tiny budget but the actual creature looks good & the possessed workers are pretty Cool in a "Prince of Darkness" kind of way & the film has that fun late-night feel to it which i love. Yes cheap & tacky effects & a Willis that really is only there for the paycheck but it's a fun little survival Apocalyptic sci-fi Thriller with a nice little bit for Thomas Jane. I liked it, good B-movie fun.
I've seen a lot of movies in my day- some good, some bad, some just ok. This one is in a category of its own. It's truly an insult to all of us that someone allowed this movie to be released.

review_title: "Oh my God, another Bruce Willis movie? It's gonna be awesome!" said no one. Ever.
review_detailed_main:
Do the tobacco companies fund John Suits' movies? Every single one has chain smoking and drunks in it.

Now this film... I have to admit, going into it with all the low ratings - and Bruce Willis is in it, I was expecting another flop. Now I'm not saying this wasn't a flop, but it was an awesome flop. And Willis was actually somewhat convincing in this role.

John Suits' directing was his usual amateur-hour. But producer, actor and co-writer Corey Large alongside co-writer and actor Edward Drake, managed to throw a whole bunch of popular sci-fi genre films in a blender, and come out with something so ridiculous, it was entertaining and hilarious at the same time. It had: Alien, Zombieland, Ghostbusters, Skyline, The Blob and many more, and although cheesy at first, the humor an audacity to do this worked for me. What's funnier, is that when I told friends about it, they were curious, and I actually didn't mind seeing it again - especially when we hit the bongs, and it was so funny and awesome, we were in stitches laughing! Try it, trust me, this is how this film was meant to be viewed.

The dated S/VFX, cheesy 80's sets, the excellent choice of colors and excellent cinematography, as well as actually having a decent score - rare for cheap B-grade films, just added to how much better this film was than any of us initially thought. The casting was ok, and although the performances lacked quality, I blame Suits for not directing his cast properly. The 92 min runtime was ok, but the pacing needed to be faster and/or the runtime cut shorter. Nevertheless, and I can't believe I'm actually saying this... but it's a recommend see, and a well deserving 6/10 from me!

This move makes you contemplate about your life choices. You question your decisions and life itself. "How has it come to this? This particular movie? What did go wrong in my life? What did go wrong in the life of Bruce Willis? The Covid maybe? Was is that bad even in Hollywood that they ended up doing this movie? Did the writer, the director and the entire creative staff died of it during production? Why did I chose this particular movie? What did watch it to the end? Is there something wrong with me? Maybe I am depressed. I maybe should see someone about it...."

review_title: How to make an unconvincing spaceship set

The plot doesn't seem to make much sense, why would you need five janitors to clean the bathrooms of 15 other people. How much mess can they make - clearly a lot as the protagonist has to spend a year cleaning toilets. Odd.

I thought the directors last film, 3022, was pretty good and was surprised its the same director of photography on this film as it just looks so bad and the shots are terrible.

I can only guess perhaps the budget wasn't there for this film or it was shot in a hurry for whatever reason. Either way its not much fun to watch unless you enjoy looking at how to cheaply make an unconvincing spaceship set.

review_title: Science fiction horror movie takes me back to the 80s
review_detailed_main:
I wanted to post a quick review of this movie because I really don't think it deserves all the negative reviews it's getting here. "Breach", to me, very much felt like a low-budget science fiction horror movie along the lines of the ones they used to make in the 80s and 90s. It's dark and gritty and, what I found to be refreshing this day and age, not politically correct at all.

One reviewer complained the sets look bad, but I thought they appeared exactly like I expect (and want) the inside of a space ship to look like in a bleak, futuristic world where Earth has gone to hell and mankind is struggling to survive. Both it and its crew reminded me of "Event Horizon" since the atmosphere and look of "Breach" are very similar to that and also reminiscent of "Alien 3". Maybe those two won't go down in history as the best science fiction movies ever made, but I, for one, still enjoyed them and I would much rather watch something like "Breach" than all of those clean and realistic ones that are being produced nowadays, like "the Martian" or "Gravity." Back in the 80s and 90s they made many dark, low budget sci fi movies, which were not very realistic at all, but that wasn't the point. They all took place in a bleak, hopeless future where humanity had destroyed all the beauty in the world and life was basically a daily struggle for survival in whatever setting the movie took place. But after "The Matrix" came out, science fiction changed (although, ironically, those films take place in a similar setting) and the only movies I can think of which were made in that style in the 2000s are "Doomsday" and "The Gene Generation", although they used a bit too much CGI for my taste. 2018's "Death Race 4: Beyond Anarchy" was better in that way and it was very refreshing to me to having been able to watch another film that tries to keep that particular niche alive. As for Bruce Willis, I thought he was very good in "Breach" and delivered pretty much what you'd expect from him in this role: the witty, tough as nails anti-hero that he's become famous for.

So give this movie a chance. Of course it's not as good as "Alien" or even "Event Horizon", but watching it, it brought back memories from when I was a teenager, checking out the science fiction and horror sections of my local video store, looking for exactly this kind of film. I'm happy it got made if only for allowing me to experience that sensation again years later when there aren't even any more of those magical places left in the world.

I read the reviews - so negative - I still watched cos of Bruce, and I liked it. A fun, tongue-in-cheek sci-fi romp. People reviewing on here take themselves too seriously and also get caught up in their opinion/dislike of an actor. Actors are allowed to do cheesy films and have some fun. Stop disrespecting Bruce. I see many reviews on IMDB where people give their disrespectful comments on good actors when their comments have no merit. And not every movie has to be deep, meaningful and Oscar-worthy. It's nice to just chill and watch a fun movie.

review_title: Movie so bad, I had to create an account to warn people.
It's depressing and violent and very unpleasant viewing...but is it THAT bad?!
review_detailed_main:
"Breach" is a film with a current rating of 3.1 on IMDB...low enough to merit its inclusion on its infamous Bottom 100 List. This would mean it's bad enough to be among the worst big budget films ever made...and as I watched the film it just didn't seem THAT bad...or even close. Sure, "Breach" is a bloody, violent and incredibly depressing film....and I am NOT singing its praises...but it is NOT 3.1 bad. It makes me wonder if there's something going on here...some attack on the film for some reason I do not understand. Again...I am not saying it's good....but it just didn't seem Bottom 100 worthy.

This very depressing story is set over 120 years from now. The population of the Earth is 19,000,000,000 and some sort of plague is destroying mankind. So, in desperation, some huge ships are sent into space in order to send a small number of humans to what's been called 'New Earth'.

The odd hero of this story is a stowaway. Most of the folk aboard the ship are in cryogenic suspension....with only a tiny complement to run the ship. During this time, some creature attacks and it's not only murderous but very smart. After invading a host's body, it begins working towards killing....and there's simply no reasoning with it....it only wants death. What's next? Well, I'm not going to spoil it in case you actually do want to see it.

Could part of the reason the film did so badly is because during COVID folks did NOT want to see a film about the destruction of the human race? Perhaps. The timing certainly COULD have been better!! Maybe, maybe not...but it certainly is NOT a feel-good film!! But despite its gloom and violence and bloodshed, it's NOT a particularly badly made film. Depressing, you betcha. Bad, not especially and I have seen hundreds, if not thousands of worse films....worse films which, somehow, have much higher ratings and less hate than this film.

review_title: Yes, Bruce Willis did this. He was bored
review_detailed_main:
This is a conversation between a Hollywood producer (or whatever company is behind this) and a "script writer":

-Hi... We need to make a sci fi movie... Can you write the script? -Yes, sure! -It will be like Alien, but with some Zombies also... You know, is fashionable. -Hmmm... Ok, no problem. -But, we need you to finish the script today, because tomorrow we start shooting. -Oh, wow, wait... Don't you think...? -I know what you are thinking, but don't worry... We will do as we usually do: false advertisement, we say is the best movie ever, bla, bla, bla... And we just put a movie star there... I think Bruce Willis is available. -Ok... so, let's do it!

...you're still going to be disappointed.

That's all you really need to know, but IMDB says my review is too short so... I don't expect much from Bruce Willis anymore and he lived down to my expectations. They have a star aboard but can't afford stars out the portholes. For some reason, they CGI'd a lighter flame...badly...for lighting a cigarette. Set looks and sounds a lot like Red Dwarf left over. There is obviously only one corridor. The reactor core is a bundle of red toy lightsabers. The plot and dialogue might have been written by remedial high schoolers. I can't comment on the acting as there wasn't any.

To be fair, I have seen worse so I gave it 2 stars to reserve space for those.

Wooden acting, tired tropes and really bad dialogue.

Had to wonder how much Willis, Jane and Nichols needed a paycheck.

A ship is on it's way to "New Earth" since original Earth and humanity is going to end but there is trouble afoot with most of the occupants in Cryo. The only complaint is that it has been done before other than that it's a pretty predictable standard movie and Bruce Willis and several of the other actors held their own despite this not being a Blockbuster Top 10 treat. Of all the Godawful movies I have had the misfortune to sit through and to come on here and see people gave this a 1/10 mainly complaining about nothing other than lost pride in Bruce is mind-numbing.
What a lousy movie. Looks like a bad Syfy channel movie.

Laughably predictably bad. A calculator stuck to a control panel? Cheap perspex boxes for cryo? Next level failure. Thomas from hottie to granddaddy. Just a sad piece of horrible.

Bruce, what were you thinking?

The worst film I've seen for a long time with low budget special effects really badly done.

I would say the best part was the ending, but even that was dreadful.

Best avoided.

Barely a story line. The actors either over-act or seem completely asleep. Willis sucks on that flask so much he can hardly get a word out. You may like it a little if you leave the volume off, maybe the picture too. Just read a book. If they make a sequel I will loose all faith in humanity.

Bruce must have lost a bet with someone or maybe he was blackmailed. Plan 9 From Outer Space is better.

The sets look like junior high shop students were hired. The lighting is horrible. The original Star Trek had better effects and sets. I would love to have the inside story on how this low budget garbage came to production.

The cryo pods were marvelously cheesy. They look like they were made the same day the scene was shot. review_title: Space thriller that could have been so much more.
review_detailed_main:
2.5 out of 5 stars.

Breach is a science fiction action film about a space crew on an interstellar voyage to a new earth to start over. They come across some parasite creature that infects a person. And spreads towards others.

The plot is decent. Concept of a space crew coming across something on the ship. That turns a person into a mindless mutant. And a monstrous creature in the end that is trying to consume life. There are other better films like this such as Pandorum. Alien.

The direction in this film is terrible. Characters do make dumb decisions. The writing is cheesy and dumb. The acting is stale. It does have a great cast ensemble of actors that were in old action movies. Like Bruce Willis. Johnny Messner. And Thomas Jane whos performance who wears aviators shades inside a spaceship. Cody Kearsley performance is stale. Everyone is wasted in a bad script. The film also lacks thrills and suspense. The action is forgettable. The cliffhanger ending is entertaining.

Wow. Seriously, I knew this was going to be a pay day film for Willis, because I never heard of it, and within 2 mins I was rolling my eyes.. set in 2248 or something and the characters are dressed in clothes from the 80s or 90s or something. In fact if this film was made in the 80s it would fit right in - still a bad sci fi, but the effects and sets are so budget. Was this filmed in some eastern European place on a budget?

What a Joke Bruce Willis - the new Nic Cage for "pay day" films.
I love me a good bad movie once in a while ... but I'd there are big actors I was expecting a good movie, this movie was horrible, it's like one of those backyard budget movies.!!

review_title: another Lockdown movie reject, we will apparently pay for any old tosh
review_detailed_main:
They will make anything and get it out there at the moment, i think they are also digging up movies that were not release because they were dreadful.

We know Bruce willis is no - Rami Malek, he fits his pigeon hole well, he reworks all his past movies as the same character with a different name.

However in this movie he's reached a new low..........sounds drunk reads a terrible script badly and even his character is useless.
Would not ever expepct BW to participate in such a nonsenss.

Hell ya this movie is horrible but thats the point. Mindless campy fun like Sharknado. Yes the acting is poor and the special effects were done in a phone, but where else will you hear Bruce Willis say, "who wants some bbq!?" While he chemically melts astro-zombies?

And the boss battle? I'm pretty sure that monster was dragging its balls.

Enjoy this movie for what it is, not for what you want it to be.

review_title: Decent sci-fi thriller above most overall. Campy and fun.
review_detailed_main: Hey, Bruce is one-note, one-song guy with a standard shtick of action plasma running through him. It's always been that way, and he does it well. When he doesn't, it's because he has crap to work with. Most "science fiction" movies are utter garbage, or at least just barely watchable if you know how to drink your way through them. Or write a little poetry, or talk to your mom during the romantic parts. This doesn't pretend to be something it's not, and thus, doesn't take itself too seriously. When I saw the ratings and looked at the trailer, I thought "Wait, something is a bit off here!" I rarely review anymore because over the years there are more and more whiners and princesses, and self-entitled primadonnas who are 100% negative, and that is NOT a "review" of a film! Complaining and belittling of any creative effort, no matter HOW seemingly bad something might be doesn't create a whole picture of an experience using the objective mindset needed to accurately explain an 'opinion' that is worthy of being taken seriously. Meaning, that too often it's ALL about the reviewer's emotions and expectations and creative 'fragility', and NOT about the movie itself. This was fun and perfectly campy, well written well acted. Everything was pretty believable and didn't insult your intelligence by pretending it was anything other than it was. It was simple and genuine and the writer knew his characters fairly well. And he wrote accordingly. The strongest arm of the movie is that it had genuine suspense! I was certainly not expecting that. Sadly, there are more and more princesses in the world writing reviews and less and less castles for them to feel safe in so they won't be SO disappointed and bereaved when a movies falls short of their narcissistic demand that it should have been better. I give it a six. The extra star is for the fact that it didn't insult expectations I never had in the first place.
It is not worth anyone's time. Skip it. Any movie is better then this one.
Quit 20 mins in. There's just no point in bothering with this one. Diahrea spinning down a toilet is more interesting.

review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
review_detailed_main: I figured it would be good as it had Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane in. How wrong can one person be. Absolute rubbish. Bad acting back plot, bad script. Bad everything.

review_title: A new low-standard of imbecility ! Producers & actors involved !
review_detailed_main: That's an epitome of how low things could get...and they did ! Bruce is completely deranged nowadays...to perform in such a stupidity...and to plan another 6 or 7 such projects for 2021 ?!? Bruce, go to a deep sleep and dream about yr Moonlighning and hope that even C. Sheperd would forgive yr actual decrepit state !

review_title: What was the budget of this movie?
review_detailed_main: $75? Does BW work for food these days? I guess so.

review_title: It should have been named tax write off
review_detailed_main: The only reason to have Bruce Willis in a movie like this is its a tax write off and it shows....

Well here we are in 2021 and it's puzzling how we're still being subjected to CGI, weapon props & redressed TV show hallways from the 1990's (I've seen better special effects on YouTube videos). This movie takes place over 200 years into the future...and yet we're still using gunpowder, AR-15 rifles, and flamethrowers that look like tactical super soaker water guns. Not sure if they blew whatever budget they had on getting permission to use the Halo warthog gun turret sound effect but the other comical part is these "futuristic" guns utilize 50-round drum magazines, yet zero shell casings come out and the AR-15 bolt dust covers remain closed when they're fired.

I've seen B-movies where one A-list star carried the movie in order to improve viewership as well as acquaint the audience with a no-name supporting cast. However, there are plenty of familiar faces in this movie (along with discount space John McClane) so I'm not sure how they duped...err I mean convinced them as well as signing Bruce Willis.

I'm not going to beat a dead horse so I'll leave the other problems with this movie to my fellow reviewers who share my opinion and we all agree, that's 90 minutes we'll never get back.

Only possible explanation for why Bruce Willis, who has starred in so very many good movies, would agree to be in this dreck.

I feel bad for him. I feel bad for Thomas Jane for his role. Most of all I feel bad for myself for watching the full 90 minutes.

You may be tempted to watch it. Don't be. You may find yourself thinking it'll get better. It won't.
Bruce is always great. I enjoyed this film a lot more than what I thought I would. Not completely my cup of cake, but it's a good one

Lower your expectations (let's face it, this *IS* a 2020 Bruce Willis DTV effort) and this movie (regardless of it's budgetary limitations) is quite effective in it's own goofy way. it's faults become it's strengths.

The limited set design, adds a sense of claustrophobia (that the actual script can't muster up) and the sparse FX (especially the barely glimpsed final monster) evoke The sense of 'accidental-suspense' that Spielberg utilized back in 1975 with 'Jaws'

Of course, it's almost sacrilege to even mention 'Jaws' and 'Breach' in the same sentence....but the (behind-the-scenes) parallels are there....if you look hard enough (and at very least there's no malfunctioning 'Bruce' in *this* movie) Willis doesn't seem to be phoning it in this time around (and certainly earns his star-billing on the DVD cover) and he features throughout the movie (instead of his usual 10 minute glorified cameo work ethic of late) Bottom line is this.....The movie needed a much bigger budget to make a dent against the majors.....but for once (given it's lofty intentions) it's budget was adequate here (and matched it's likewise 'scope') Fans of 'Alien' (1979) will be sorely disappointed....Whereas fans of 'Inseminoid' (1981) might get a kick out of this movie (and the bare-bone 80's synth score, doesn't hurt either)

I enjoyed it, anyhow

What i have just watched.......the producer have to pay me to watch this

It's the year 2242 and Earth is in chaos. Those who could leave have left for a planet known as New Earth. Noah (Cody Kearsley) is a janitor on the last spaceship leaving Earth. The passengers are in cryo-sleep while he is part of a skeleton crew maintaining the ship.

The special effects are inferior as expected. There are good actors here but the lead is not one of them and I'm not sure if Bruce Willis is one anymore. The set designs are weak. review_detailed_main:
Seldom have I seen anything this bad. The acting is bad and the effects are bad. Period. The story COULD have been good with some SERIOUS re-writing but oh boy, don't waste your time. It's one hot sticky mess.

Bruce Willis....what on EARTH were you thinking???

Oh my God, Buget for this must have been less than a dinner at an expensive restaurant, actors must have done a favor for director. I dont see how some known names in Hollywood must have played in this pure Garbage of a movie. It looked awful from the beginning but i watched to see how deep the hole goes, it,s very very deep. Anti-Life (aka Breach): Not as bad as some say but still a bit of a mess. Bruce Willis is getting as bad as Nick Cage in accepting every role he's offered and here he plays a grizzled old veteran Space Navy Captain busted to the ranks for disobeying orders. He's on a Space Ark (doing menial work), fleeing earth as the environment finally collapses. 300,000 colonists (most in cryogenic sleep) are onboard, voyaging to New Earth which circles a distant star. But there's an alien parasite aboard! It kills crew members and then reanimates their bodies. They act and look like fast moving zombies so this is basically a zombies in space movie. The plot is a bit confused with a few hole and non-sequiturs. The acting and set design won't win any award either but it has a certain charm which kept me engaged, maybe it was the zombie element. Or the homages to Aliens, The Thing and other SF/Horror films. It had the ingredients to be a much better film but is just about watchable on a rainy evening. Directed by John Suits from a screenplay by Edward Drake and Corey Large. On Netflix. 5/10.
I'm giving this 10/10! If you're looking for an appallingly bad movie here you go! No wonder Bruce drank his way through it!!
As long as you have low expectations you will have fun! Silly horror syfy! Look alike actors too, with a Jodie Foster (Chambers) and a Billy Zane/Matthew McConaughey (Teek). Cheesy action!

review_title: A c-level sci-fi/horror cut and paste job, only distinguished by the fact that Bruce Willis is in more of it than you'd expect.
review_detailed_main:
In the 23rd century, Humanity and Earth are on the cusp of an extinction level event and have begun evacuations for the colony of New Earth. Noah (Cody Kearsley) stows away on the U. S. S. Hercules impersonating a junior janitor while his pregnant girlfriend Hayley (Kassandra Clementi) is granted passage due to her father being the Admiral (Thomas Jane). While the passengers are put into hyper sleep Noah goes about custodial duties on the ship under the supervision of a demoted captain turned custodian, Clay (Bruce Willis), until eventually members of the support staff turn up dead or missing with signs pointing towards something inhuman as the culprit.

To look at Bruce Willis' career is depressing because not too long ago the man appear in major blockbusters such as G. I. Joe Retaliation, RED 2 and A Good Day to Die Hard, while these movies weren't critically well received (for good reason) they were at least projects that made sense given Willis' status as an international action star. But outside of exceptions like Glass and a cameo in Motherless Brooklyn, Willis' primary output has been direct-to-video/streaming fodder for the company Emmett/Furla/Oasis with these film's featuring Willis prominently as the second billed actor despite only being in it for maybe 10 minutes with the rest done off camera or with a body double. With only two days of shooting and guaranteed $1 million pay day for each film it's no mystery why Willis has gone down this route. Breach (aka Anti-Life) isn't an EFO production, but it does reunite Willis with some crew who have worked on his EFO films, and while Willis is more prominent here than he was in many EFO film's the quality is definitely not improved simply because there's more of Willis.

The movie is supposedly set in the 23rd century, but begins with a bunch of stock footage framed with a fish eye lens before transitioning to our "future" which looks like a rented storage area with a few dozen extras and a shambly chain link fence. And of course once we're actually on the ship things don't improve because it's clear it's just a refurbished warehouse with some red and green lights shined on walls with maybe the occasional flatscreen TV or poorly inserted hologram effect to assure the audience "no seriously, this is the future!". The movie features some brief CGI shots of the ship, but they're not particularly well rendered and it just calls attention to the fact that sets the crew are using are much smaller than it is. Not only is it unconvincing but despite being set in the 23rd century, the bathrooms on the ship look like public restrooms one would find at a bus stop and they're still using regular guns (which are cheap plastic replicas) except for one point where they break out cheap plastic lasers.

The movie doesn't even have a good story behind its lackluster production values, because it's basically a cut and paste job of most of the Alien knockoffs of the 80s, but without any tradecraft or endearing qualities that made films like Galaxy of Terror or Creature enjoyable. Surprisingly though, the film despite being marketed as such isn't as directly ripping off Alien as one might think (at first anyway). The movie throws in zombie tropes, bits from The Thing, and even a little bit of Space Mutiny (though at least Space Mutiny stole special effects from John Dykstra). Most of the plot beats of this story you'll be able to predict as they're pretty much all here just because they were in other movies. Willis looks visibly uninterested despite being a prominent actor in the film with more screentime here than he had in most of his EFO projects, and Cody Kearsley of TV's Riverdale is not an engaging presence and feels hopelessly lost and confused with no real idea how to approach this character.

On occasion I got a chuckle from some of the line deliveries (sometimes intentionally sometimes not) and there was a creature effect in the last ten minutes of the movie that looked okay(not great, but good enough) but then they overextended themselves with some rather inept expansions on it to try and milk all they could from it.

Breach is a sad movie. It plays like one of those 90s direct to video films that tried to ape Alien's aesthetic on a miniscule budget, but at least those were made with no name actors on shoestring budgets and were kind of endearing in how stupid they were such as Leprechaun 4: In Space. Breach is just bare basics recycled to diminishing returns with the barest minimum of effort put in and sold to you using cast members like Bruce Willis to bank on their name recognition.

Yes that's right folks ... Bruce Willis worked for 2 days and had his stand do the other 22 days filming ... #lazy. Don't buy into bruce he's a tired old and needs to go away and stop thinking he's gods gift to movies ..

Not often I can finish a film, but man this one is sooooo bad.

Low budget doesn't have to mean a bad film, but this is so low budget, you have to try really hard not to laugh at the props and sets.

How can any so called professional be involved in making this drivel and feel like they'd done a good job?

If you can last more than 30 mins, you're doing better than me.

review_title: How do I get off this ship?

review_detailed_main: Truly, truly appalling film - there is absolutely nothing to commend. The sets are laughable - plywood with cross-head screws visible, sprayed appliance/tv foam packing stuck to walls, and a "reactor" made from neon tubes! The acting is even worse. The best that could happen to this is the fate other turkeys befall at Christmas.
Why did this movie happen? Surely, the people responsible for this knew it sucked, yet they did nothing about it! Why?

review_title: This is definitely better than the average Bruce Willis movie lately. Not terrific, but a decent enough B-movie, with good acting and suspense. Sort of an ALIEN copycat...
review_detailed_main:
Hmmm... I was pleasantly surprised watching Breach, expecting another total flop. The 3 stars rating dont do justice to this movie. I see ALL Bruce Willis movies (ever made) and yes Bruce made a lot of flops lately, but this one does stick out in a positive way....

The good: photography and sound are quite excellent. Really beautiful photography and the sound is up to par as well, and I am one who is usually really critical of these kind of technical details.

More good: the supporting actors are quite decent. One of them being even really good. The bad guy of this movie is really a tough dude. Acts quite good. I have seen him in other B-movies and he simply should be starring in popular A-movies, because he honestly has got the charisma.

Concluding: expect a B-movie and you could have a nice watch, full of suspense, action and cool, tough guys.
I just wasted seven bucks on this piece of garbage. Idiot plot, bad acting, and extremely cheesy special effects. I do wonder how this thing ever got made.

I've always wondered what it would look like seeing a major hollywood star setting fire to himself on film. Now I have.

Think Event Horizon has love with The Room and you'll find Breach somewhere in that.

Thank you for becoming a comedic actor by accident Brucey.

There are a lot of negative reviews on this film. I think the problem is that lots of people think without multi-million pound flawless CGI a film can't be any good. Luckily I am of a generation that doesn't need this to be the case. I like a bit of entertainment and tongue in cheek humour. I was expecting not to like this film but I did find it quite engrossing and enjoyable. Bit of a cross between alien, red dwarf and various zombie films. There is a lot of running up-and-down the same corridor and Bruce Willis does pretty well despite getting on a bit believe me I have seen him in much worse films recently.

review_title: I enjoyed it more than most reviewers.
review_detailed_main: It was a decent alien, dystopian thriller until the end. Willis's dialog was not written that well. Where I really thought it sucked was the ending. I won't go into details, but it was not good in a number of ways. The alien effects were not good overall.

review_title: Don't take this one too seriously
review_detailed_main:
This flick is what it is- don't take it too seriously! Also try not to look for logic or unpredicable things to happen. It has "taken" from so many movies like The last Days on Mars, Prometheus, The Hidden, Pandora, The Thing, Life etc that there is no space in the movie for original things to add :D.

Many reviewers are sour about the acting and the set - what would you expect? This is a low cost space / horror/ shooter/ no brainer. Bruce Willis brought his usual drunkard "I'am too cool so shove it" role to cash in - which is fine with me: I like him no matter what.

I also like this early 90's vibe of "ZS" category (that is the last letter in hungarian alphabet. Yes, that two is one letter/ sound) and for that this one is quite decent.

Just pop your fav drink and enjoy the ride.

You will forget it by tomorrow anyways.

It's the era of "B" movies. Funny garbage that we love to watch and laugh at, not with.

However, that being said there's a point where B movies go from being fun to being just bad. This film, no matter how it tried to be a kitschy B movie, was just bad.

First of all, when you're embarrassed for the actors in the film, it makes it uncomfortable. Had this film not contained Bruce Willis it might have been less cringe worthy. Bruce was just agonizing to watch. We know he's better. If he's trying to be bad on purpose, it wasn't working. Sorry Bruce, you're not a clown.

I was also really ashamed of Thomas Jane who I really liked in The Expanse.

I think they blew their entire Sci Fi budget simulating a worm jumping into a beer bottle.

Anyway, it wasn't clever or fun or laughable. It just makes you feel unclean by watching it.

Occasionally you watch a movie that is so bad you wonder why anyone wasted their time making it and distributing it.

This is one of them, the effects, lighting, sets and acting are terrible, the camera goes in too close, not to create atmosphere but to reduce the need for backgrounds and sets, even the sound is muffled sounds as if it was recorded on someone's old i phone.

Last of all is the shocking editing and acting, the editor used a pocketknife, which creates a lost feeling for the viewer " where are we ?", the actors literally look as though someone handed them their lines 2 minutes before the cameras started to roll, they look lost except for a few of the B grade support cast who are simply shocking, shocking actors. A total waste of time.

review_title: It can't be as bad as so many reviews proclaim, can it?
review_detailed_main: Well, yes it can. Decided to watch out of curiosity to find out if what people are saying is true. On every level, this film seems to exist solely for the purpose lowering IQs around the world -- or making a quick buck. With little effort, the film could have been made as a decent parody of Alien. It could have been hilarious. Instead, the audience is subjected to what appears to be a high school project with a couple of well-known actors appearing as a favor to their kids.

review_title: GarFy - I can't believe Bruce Willis put his name to this movie!
review_detailed_main:

You said if they gave out awards for bad movies this would win.. those awards are called The Razzies. They give out awards for such things as Worst Movie, Worst Actor & Actress etc.

Also, could tell this movie sucks just by previewing the trailer for 10 seconds. Every Bruce Willis led films these days are consistently awful. He will take any role he is offered. He's the new Nicholas Cage. Except Cage is the type of awful that you can laugh at. With Willis it's just embarrassing and depressing.
It is what it is. Marginally better than Scfi channel caliber. People need to stop expecting everything to be Dune. Sometimes you just want Starship Troopers
Film could of been better, good entertainment No sex no nudity. Recommend to family to watch it ..
What on earth was Willis thinking ? This film was absolutely dire on every single level. There is nothing redeeming about this pile of crap. Avoid at all costs.
Worst rental I have paid for and still can't figure why Bruce Willis agreed to star in it. When he looks back at it I bet he will be embarrassed.

WOW. This is not a good WOW BTW. I'm almost lost for words. This film is horrendous. I can't believe how far Bruce has fallen, is he skint, producing, doing a favour for friends, what is it? Some of these actors have actually done good films. It's so cheap, pealing stickers over the brand of TV monitors, wobbly sets, I'm pretty sure they use NERF guns as weapons. Terrible beyond belief!

I'm probably a bit biased, but I love cheesy scifi movies. The fact that Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane were in this one makes it all the better.

It was a bit dry, but this wasn't going for any Oscars or anything.

Passed an hour and a half and I'll probably watch it again at some point.
This moment, when one of the best actors team up with some random non-actors, take some drugs and want to recreate Aliens in 2020. I thought that pandemic was already bad, but this is way worse...

And not wow in a good way!

When I sat down to watch the 2020 movie "Breach" from writers Edward Drake and Corey Large I must admit that I was expecting a lot more from the movie that what director John Suits delivered. Why was that? Well, I mean a movie that had both Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane on the cast list? What could possibly go wrong here? What would there be not to like?

Apparently if you take the movies "Alien" and "28 Days Later" and mix them together, you'd have the formula for "Breach" (aka "Anti-Life"), except that "Breach" lacked the intensity and entertainment that both those movie have. "Breach" just feels like a watered down hybrid version of those two movies, where all energy has been sucked away.

The storyline in "Breach" was as unoriginal as anything could be. Again, I redirect your attention to the "Alien" and "28 Days Later" movies and you have the storyline that writers Edward Drake and Corey Large managed to come up with. I am especially impressed that something like this would pass today and make it to the screen.

Thomas Jane was not really all that much in the movie, which was good, as this movie will not tarnish his movie record all that much. Bruce Willis, however, was there almost all the time, and this movie was a swing and a miss from him, and it doesn't make a great addition to his repertoire of movies.

I managed to sit through the movie to the very end, though I was hardly entertained by "Breach". In fact, I was more dumbfounded that a movie so blatantly ripping off two established movies could see the light of day. And the ending of the movie, now that was just a slap to the face. The storyline have you beaten down and stepped upon, but the ending just brings a cold, dead fish to the game and slaps your face repeatedly. That ending was just abysmal. Not only was it generic and predictable, but it was just saying that the audience watching it deserved no better.

You might want to do yourself a favor and give "Breach" a wide berth. It is not worth the time, money or effort, believe you me. My rating of this 2020 movie lands on a generous three out of ten stars.

review_title: Would have given this a solid -10 / 10 if I could
review_detailed_main:
This has to be one of my contenders for worst movies of 2020.

First lets start with the premise: An unknown disaster has struck Earth and this is the second out of two ships headed for another habitable planet (dubbed "New Earth") before the last survivors on Earth are wiped out. An alien lifeform has somehow made it's way onto the ship and inhabits increasingly more dead crew mates.

The movie is predictable at every turn, the writing is poor and full of plot holes. The writers are completely incompetent. I actually feel hard-pressed to call them writers, as what they've produced is barely even a movie. It just felt like a bit of a bad joke throughout.

I can't believe I wasted my time watching this, so I've just created an account in order to leave this review.

Let's be honest here, this is a bad movie. However, it's still better than Disney Star Wars trilogy and GoT season 6-8 combined. Appreciated some of the nods (e.g. bunks looking like something from Red Dwarf).

Okay, I'm being VERY generous, giving this a 4/10, but I will admit I sort of enjoyed this in a 'so bad it's fun' way. After watching the truly execrable 'Cosmic Sin' by the same director, my other half and I decided to we had to watch 'Anti-Life' (or 'Breach) just to see if it was equally terrible. And you know what? Shockingly, it wasn't!

That's not to say 'Anti-life' is good, by any means. It's actually pretty dreadful, but in comparison to 'Cosmic Sin', it at least had a vaguely coherent storyline, and progressed at a reasonable pace. Given that Bruce Willis and Rachel Nichols were in this for most of its run time (rather than the usual 'I could've shot my scenes in a day'), and that they're both good actors, I don't know why they didn't simply re-write the script to make them the leads. They would have been far better than the rather ineffectual unknown who plays the actual lead, and his even worse-acting romantic interest.

Essentially the whole thing is an ultra-low-budget 'Alien' clone, with a dash of 'The Thing', already done numerous times in the 80s and 90s. It's so low budget, I would be amazed if it cost more than... I don't know... $100k? And 90% of that would've been on Bruce, Thomas Jane and Rachel Nichols.

It's such a low budget production, that they've used every old trick in the book. Packing crates for shining light through, various randomly shaped packaging items on the walls, spray painted to match the colour of the set, etc... As such, it's actually a fun example of how young up-and-coming film students can create sci-fi sets with zero budget!!

Even at 'Anti Life's worst, you can play 'spot the polystyrene packaging on the wall', which keeps things fun. Oh, and don't forget the painted NERF guns with badly composited muzzle flashes!

It's all pretty bad, but it IS entertaining in a silly, cheesy, low budget way, most reminiscent of 90s made-for-tv movies, when poor CGI was just becoming available for low-budget efforts to throw at the screen.

What can I say? I've seen a LOT worse, and it was more entertaining than The Last Jedi (My favourite stunningly-low-bar comparison movie, for all bad movies to be compared against). I didn't fall asleep before the end, which is something I can't even say of some Marvel movies. ;-)

Ok so Bruce Willis phones it in and has no expression, and the CGI thing isn't the best. But if u think this is the worst movie ever made, then I am jealous of u as i have sat through much worse. Cody Kearsley does a great job especially against the standard of acting he had to build a rapport with.

Anyway, it wasnt amazing, wasnt terrible, but it was ok.

I tried to like this but I just could NOT! This has got to be one of THE worst movies I've ever seen, and I've watched a lot of movies over the last 60 or so years. The first thing I noticed were there the fluorescent tube lights they used to make the ships engine.
I hated every bit of this movie. This was more annoying than anything else.
Do not rent, buy, or even watch for free!! Complete waste of time. Horrible horrible horrible. Wouldn't even give it 1 star!

review_title: This film is a reminder Why scripts need to be revised, and why storyboard artists are important.
review_detailed_main:
It's staggering to consider that this film bombed from terrible writing and lack of creative shots, but let's break it down. First the good: -good actors -good props and set deck -good lighting -good post production (vfx and colour correction) -good cameras and audio

And now what destroys all that in a heart beat -Bad scripting, seemingly the first version of the script was what was used in the final film. -unclear confusing story, this goes hand in hand with scripting. -unclear and confusing dialogue, also, a writing and scripting problem. -no story boarding so shots look mediocre. Did they even change the lenses on the camera? at that point might As well shoot it on an iPhone 12 Pro Max. -the directing, the entire movie feels like every first take made it into final. -the director of photography, what ate you even doing? This was boring and painful to watch.

Clearly the production got decent funding, cut corners, don't bother hiring additional writers, storyboard artists, or anyone who knew what was happening on the set, paid for an a lister, backed the profits, and extra cash, and walked away...

Kinda a great way to make money during a pandemic if I should say so lol.

I mean....just....what have I just experienced? I had my covid vaccine today and I feel I have just hallucinated the last hour and a half.

Bruce Willis, Thomas Jane, Callan Mulvey, Rachel Nicols.

How on earth are you in his movie that looked like it had a budget of £2.50?

I was hoping to discover this movie was made for charity (I've checked, it's not). I can only assume the producers lined up the cast and then realised they had spent the last penny in the cookie jar and it was more expensive to pull the project, so some mates knocked something up in their back garden.

I am just stunned. In this day and age a movie of this (lack of) plot, effects, production, script was even given the green light, let alone lure in a cast of this potential.

Netflix...this is the sole reason your stock has dropped recently...haven't you figured this out yet.

Please, for the love of all things Holy, DON'T waste your time watching this even for curiousity. It's stinks, it will make your eyes and brain hurt.

I will probably read an article from the DIrector stating they were trying to re-envisage a B movie from the 1970s. If he did, they still failed as they were 10x more entertaining.

2020 was most defintely a year to forget. Now, for more reasons than one.

review_title: Bad Script period, decent effort as simple brainless fun, strong sound editing, bad VFX
review_detailed_main: Firstly Bruce is the weakest link in this whole production, I find it surprising to read reviews blaming other aspects of the filmmaking, when everyone else is working with tiny fractions of the budget. Its very very obvious that these are paycheck films for Bruce. Its not a hidden fact that he will only work for an enormous price tag and these are the producers (who aren't very good at writing films) willing to fit that bill and everything else is chicken feed left for the rest of creatives. Blame everyone for continuing to watch them because they see Bruce. Maybe pay attention to smaller productions that can evenly spread the effort to make a decent film. As a B-movie this is much better than the majority of others I've seen though. As I actually like B-movies and watch them, with the majority have terrible dialogue, and sound editing. This actually excels at sound that since a lot of action is happening off screen and the VFX are not doing it any justice but sadly they are very bad unfortunately which is breaking the entire filmmaking illusion. Its brainless fun even though overall the script was bad. Rating this a 8 because a lot have unfairly judge it, because they may see Bruce and expect the moon. Those days are over.

This is not bad. Not ten stars but I am a fan. It was like Pandorum meets Doom. I do not watch Bruce Willis movies so I think Willis fans might be confused. Gotta say this is a sexy side of Thomas Jane I am not used to lol.

Run away from this movie regardless how far into it you've already watched-absolutely nothing in this movie is worth a second more of your time!!

review_title: Some people just want to be a Troll!
review_detailed_main:
Someone's review started with the following sentence. Breach is a bad low budget film that rips off Alien, The Thing, Predator and 28 Days Later. Now I don't care if this is okay, the best or the worst. If you believe a single movie can even achieve this and Rip Off four yeah, I said 4 different movies, then you shouldn't be wasting anyone's time being a movie critic and should stay far away from the reviews.

Using this person's Troll like and petty logic ahem sarcasm then every movie ever made is a "Rip Off" of at least 4 other movies!! As long as they are kind of similar.

Like I said before. In this review, I don't care about the quality of this or any other movie. This is for that Troll or anyone that does the same thing. Comparing a movie to 4 others and claiming it is a rip off of all 4. Stop wasting people's time implying that every movie ever made is just a rip off because it resembles 4 other movies. Lmfao.

I do not believe this movie was made with any seriousness - it's a spoof, and joke. I don't understand why it was even made. Was the director trying to ruin his own career? Perhaps one of the worst movies I've seen in my entire life.

Why did Bruce Willis and Thomas Jane lend their names to this movie. I will no longer watch movies listing these actors, or producers. There was no effort put in the acting or story line for this movie. It was amateur beyond anything I watch.

There was no story line, the actors were unbelievable, the storyline was unbelievable and Bruce Willis exerted no effort in any of the supposedly dangerous scenes. My husband and I only watched it to the end because we were aghast at the quality of acting and thought there might be something better coming soon. This is ninety minutes we will never get back.

review_title: 1 drop per gallon of cleaning solution in plastic jug

review_detailed_main:
I often wonder at what point do good Hollywood actors simply take a pay check to carry on working.. Bruce Willis is one of Hollywood's finest actors, he never chooses too overly complicated roles and always a quirky sense of "why am i in this situation" nevertheless he's a brilliant actor who always delivers his lines with impeccable timing and looks like a guy I'd be drinking friends with. The same goes for Rachel Nichols, she's a lovely wonderful brilliant actress who was under used in this role (I might add) the same goes for Callan Mulvey and Timothy Murphy, again underused as they are both good method actors..

But for me, what broke the 4th wall wasn't the effects or the god awful lighting or their use of grey corridors, but the use of the Red Dwarf bedrooms, in fact I'm pretty sure all the corridor scenes were stolen from the Red Dwarf set too.

The alien, doing then black goop eye thing was straight out of the X files as was the whole alien premise, but nevertheless a damn fine Sunday afternoon movie with a decent level of suspense. Breaking the suspension of disbelief, the autopsy scene is simply laughable, so why don't they get real specialists in to block out these scenes... finally, does no one know what a headshot is ????

In fact now I've gone back and looked at it, watch any Red Dwarf episode and you'll see what I mean about the sets..

Nevertheless, I'd still go drinking with Bruce or Rachel

review_title: Great movie, probably one of the best 2020 films
review_detailed_main: This movie is almost as good as Die Hard. If you are a Bruce Willis fan, this is definitely worth a watch. You won't regret it.

This is my first review, I'm writing it as we've just watched this film and thoroughly enjoyed it. It's a bit of fun, and does what films do, it entertained!

I do think some people take some things too seriously, just chill and enjoy a bit of space based Zombie-ish nonsense!
Bruce always seemed liked a likable guy. Why did he agree to do this movie?

Clearly a 5/10 or 6/10.

Lots of **** have given it 1/10 for whatever insane reason, but it's objectively not that bad.

It's kind of a cheap version of event horizon.

For most parts the acting is okay. The special effects are okay. Even the plot is okay. It's not good, it's also not, objectively, that bad.

For most parts it's a run of the mill horror/Sci-Fi movie that is soon forgotten. Like half the movies at the cinema.

I generally would not recommend any movie with an IMDb score below 7/10. Movies which are 6/10 can be seen if you're a fan of this type of genre. There are lots and lots of action and drama movies with an IMDb score of 6/10 that are okay to watch.

In conclusion: go watch something else (there's literally thousands of action, Sci-Fi and horror movies that are better than this movie), but it's still, objectively, a lot better than the IMDb score.
I've never written a bad review for a movie before, but Breach was so incredibly bad that I had to get it off my chest. Do yourself a favor and skip this one...
Reviewers are trashing Bruce Willis, but honestly Suits needs to go back to directing commercials. This is worse than ANY B movie I have ever seen.

review_title: There's bad and then there's this...
review_detailed_main:
I love a good cheesy, apocalyptic B-movie. And I think with a little less effort, they wouldn't have overshot "B" and delivered whatever this is.

The plot was at least...plausible. But the direction, inability of lighting to work with make up effects, shamelessly wobbling sets and music that seems to be completely generated on a first generation MacBook - well, I hate to knock someone for trying, but the only department that seems to have at least partially succeeded at their job here was casting when then got Bruce Willis. I'm just curious what looming balloon payment caused him to agree to this project.

In some ways this movie has likable aspects while being a train wreck. I really the soundtrack and Sci-Fi bits especially when they explain about a quantum time leap that was sweet! I don't know why Bruce Willis's career plummeted in the last few years. For a cheesy horror sci-fi it's solid, I understand hating it too a lot of the dialogue is a mess and it's made with porno directed style.

I went into this movie expecting something... you know? Good? I mean it has Bruce in it.

I was soooo confused until I realized this, my friends, this is a B movie. Once you accept that, it's still terrible. 10/10 as a B movie. 0/10 as an actual good movie. Haha! This show is a disaster!!!!!

Yippy kayay mother B movies!

review_title: Oh my God, this is bad!!!
review_detailed_main: Surely this has to be one of the worst films ever!!

review_title: Hilariously Bad - A Masterpiece of Moronic Movie Making
review_detailed_main:
I'm a massive fan of bad movies and after this hilariously awful flick ended I was certain that Asylum Studios had somehow managed to nab Bruce Willis.

In terms of hitting the bullseye for bad movie metrics Anti-Life (Breach) hits them all. Bad acting, nonsensical story line, junkyard sets, pathetic special effects, laughable make up, amateurish directing and a cringe inducing ending, there is not even a single positive thing about this movie.

Not one single thing.

Asylum Studios have their work cut out if they ever attempt to produce something as bad as this.

And as for Bruce Willis, he's obviously gone from Die Hard. To Hard Up.

Great? No.

Good? Hmm.

Watchable? Yes.

Garbage? No.

Think late 70's, early 80's sci-fi where effects were dubious, sets were cheap and cting was campy.

If you like that sort of thing, you'll probably like this. If not, you'll probably hate it.

We enjoyed it, but we're B grade sci-fi buffs.

I watched the movie to the end, because I was thinking it had to get better. But take my advice, don't watch this movie, and if you start don't waste time seeing it to the end. It will not improve, and you just end up with a feeling of the life is to short to this movie.
I ..just..can't. And..that ending. What the actual fudge. I agree with most critics here, something is up with Bruce.

review_title: Wow. Somebody actually paid to have this made.
review_detailed_main: Seriously one of the worst movies I've watched. I hope the actors and crew were paid well because they may never work again.

Since Bruce Willis' illness it's understandable why he accepted the role in this and has also done so in other bad films. His acting isn't so bad considering the circumstances, which must have been challenging for him to say the least!

Maybe it was made with Bruce's own money in an effort to keep his brain functioning and thereby helping to slow-down his illness, as challenges with communication are just one symptom of the disease (FTD), which Bruce is suffering with.

More specifically Bruce's diagnosis is: 'frontotemporal dementia'.

The film on the other hand is a different story, and to be honest, one of the worst film's i've ever watched (to the end)! Sadly, it is bad on almost every level, set, script, ending, tech, CGI, (think; Star Wars - 35 years ago and compare).

So, well done Bruce for effort and a huge thank you to all fellow cast members for staying with, and supporting the, leading role, Bruce's behaviour may well have been a difficult challenge to work with.
There are many comical moments that make it worth watching. But how people get the money to make garbage like this is such a mystery to me.
I felt embarrassed watching this. Was it on purpose that this had to look so amateur and embarrassing?

I'm with those that have come here to see if I'm alone in not being able to find any redeeming features. It took me three sittings to finish the film, and I did that purely because I didn't think the film could get worse. How wrong I was.

Bruce Willis looks genuinely bored as he delivers the lines someone actually spent time writing, and this script reads like a first draft that someone waking from a fever dream wrote.

I can only imagine the vision behind the film might have been far reaching, but blowing the budget on a couple of names has killed the project dead.

The final line of the film, delivered by the 'hero' who has literally spent almost the entire film walking along behind those that get killed, sums up the whole piece.but it's still not worth sitting through the rest of this tosh to get to.

They really should have burned the script. All of the pages.

Terrible. Sets a new bar for how bad sci-fi can get.

review_title: So bad i had to give it a 10, only for fun..
review_detailed_main:
Really guys, what happened with this crap?

How did you even get to engage Willis for this crap? It hurts how bad it is. And the Oscar for the bigggest crap of the year goes to: everyone on this project🤣
I have one major question. Is Bruce Willis in desperate need of money? This film is not bad as a B-movie and the concept is pretty good. You just have to make sure your standards are pretty low.

review_title: All the above plus horrible sound quality
review_detailed_main: This looked like it might be interesting in the list of free Amazon Prime films. I started watching and it seemed that it might possibly be good. Wrong. It's not often that I don't bother finishing a film but this is one of those times. Boring rubbish made worse by muffled and mumbled speech. I have a decent 2023 model LG TV with matching sound bar but even after selecting "clear voice" from the sound menu I couldn't decifer much of the speech. I had the TV up so loud that the sound effects were likely to be heard half way down the street. What a shame that Bruce Willis somehow chose to be involved with such drivel.

After 5 minutes my wife and I looked at each other and said Is this possibly so bad?

And I'm sorry to say but the rest of the film was.

Do something else than waste your time on this film.
This was really bad! I dont have Words that can describe how bad this movie was!

As many has written, this was not a good movie. The set can be seen flopping around in places, weird camera angles to basically hide I guess made the "action" scenes strange at many places. CGI looks like it was made in the good old 80s...which by today's standards are just laughable.

Sadly, this was dumb.

Typically love the actors, love this kind of movie, love sci-fi in general. But, no. Not this time.

review_title: Can I give it zero stars?
review_detailed_main: Why Bruce? Why are you embarrassing yourself like this? Between this and Cosmic Sin.... omg. If you'd said you was that hard up I'd have sent you a tenner for a coffee.

Sorry but I couldn't get past the screen going all over the place. I HATE movies where somehow the "Director" seems to think it's "professional". Anyway, after reading the rest of the reviews, it went in the bin.

I DID not see this one coming, how in the love of god can so many big names such as Bruce Willis, Thomas Jane and. Timothy V Murphy be a part of this really, like REALLY bad excuse of a movie, wow.... How could this be? Bad script, bad scenery, REALLY bad acting. WOW. Mind blown, in a really bad, BAD way.

review_title: A very successful science fiction film
review_detailed_main: A sacred sci-fi movie with a story in Alien but who is frankly very successful. There is tension, suspense, anxiety but also good action scenes and endearing characters I found. I had a great time looking at this movie.

I'm no critic and I rarely read reviews on anything!

I like to form my own opinions and impressions.

What was unexpected once the film began was my inability to move from my seat!

Captivated!

Was this a Sharknado-type flick?

An intentionally really bad film?

An attempt at a parody of a 1970s sci-fi movie?

(Can't touch Ridley Scott!) Or simply a great little piece of entertainment?

The cast? Fantastic.

Bruce Willis! Love it.

I mean, when was the original Dune produced????

Not even close.

But the sets, the acting, props, score......whatever the budget was, all worked well enough together that i couldn't take my eyes off the screen!

I enjoyed this!

If you are looking for Ridley Scott? This is the wrong film.

Mr. Willis in 5th Element?

Na uh.

Want something that leaves you wondering why?.....how???

Want to have a laugh then ask your fellow big screen buffs "what's so funny?" Check this out.

I give this flick 6/10 simply for having me glued to the screen the entire time.

That's rare.

🙂

Fun fact: during the first part of the movie you see several shots of the mess hall at the ship where on all tables there's a metal waste bin with holes... from IKEA! I recognized them immediately, because I have one myself. It made me laugh out loud and I couldn't take the movie seriously after that. I kept thinking about it. What sci-fi filmmaker uses something like that without adapting it so that viewers will not immediately recognize it?

After watching for about 20 minutes, I decided I did not want to waste my time any further on this, so I stopped. I actually came to IMDb to read the reviews and see if I missed something, but apparently not.

review_title: If you like bad scifi this the Mona Lisa!
review_detailed_main:
I'm an OG Star Wars fan, so in my search for scifi I've watched some pretty awful films. This one stands over all imitators for badness.

A premise that makes little sense, a plot that makes less and with so many holes I had no idea how many key events were arrived at. The script was worse than most fan fiction. The acting just grim, I can imagine that every shot was 'got it on the first take'.

I gave it ten minutes on its own merits, and watched the rest to see just HOW awful it is. This is one of very, very few movies that truly deserves a 1. If you have similar 'road crash' masochistic tendencies as me, good humour and a strong tolerance for terrible cinema I can heartily recommend Anti Life/Breach.

On television, this was listed as 'Edge of your seat sci-fi thriller'.

Sadly, the only reason you'd be on the edge of seat is waiting for something to happen or, to get the remote to change channels.

As other reviews have stated, it's slow & lacks any kind of grip to keep you watching. I couldn't follow the supposed story line & it wasn't for lack of trying, but whoever came up with this idea, certainly didn't put it on screen to be enticing at all.

If you want to watch a film with Bruce in it, then you'd be better searching for one that has a 7.0 rating or above, but steer well clear of this junk.

In addition to BW in the film, there were a number of recognizable faces!! Did they all lose a bet? How in the world did they all agree to this? If it was a comedy I could have forgiven them for this!!!

review_title: ZERO STARS. What has become of you Bruce!!

review_detailed_main: Star Trek of the living dead.is the best way to describe this movie!!!

99% of all films about space and technology are pessimistic. "The Breach" seems to me refreshingly optimistic about technology if probably somewhat ambiguous when it comes to space and the future. Compared to the "Alien" franchise though which is unambiguously dystopian and where you find a lot of toxic masculinity, the masculinity at play here and its goal, most people will propably end up sympathising with. To me it smells a bit like the people behind this film had different opinions of what the message should be. Nevertheless this low-budget film is in my view by far the best about these topics, second only to "Interstellar" which is also much more serious in tone.

Admittedly, Bruce in his later years needs a good director to direct him, but as in "Death Wish" here it succeeds and Bruce's performance as a result is more than decent. Furthermore most of the other actors are top-notch and what we have is a very entertaining film. Especially the first hour and the ending I find hilarious. At first it may seem like just pure entertainment but I must say it has grown on me since I first saw it some months ago. It's not that it's especially deep but nor is it the opposite. When I first saw it I would have given it 5 or 6 out of 10 but maybe because generally I don't care so much about how expensive films look, I think there's more to it than maybe first meets the eye. The fact that I find the actors and the dialogue so good and funny is for me the most essential.

I could imagine that some of the reviewers who give this a negative rating find the masculinity here a tad too toxic. For me they found just the right balance.

In fact "The Breach" should in no way be seen as controversial and is a prime example of how a film can have a lot of humor without seeking the limits of free expression. Certainly compared to the 80's it's very harmless.
Its so bad. Makes Dark side of the sun to be an Oscar movie.

review_title: Bruce does another Indie flick, but this one ain't no 12 Monkeys.
review_detailed_main: Every so often, Bruce Willis does an Indie film, probably not for the pay packet, but more for the fun of trying something different. Some of those become rally good, others really bad. This is somewhere in the middle. When you see "Willis", Racheal Nichols, and Thomas Jayne in a SciFi, you'd expect you'd get quality, especially if you add in supporting actors from the Marvel-Verse. sadly the technical side of the film is let down by some poor choices, both in the "Lets do a whole film hand-held" decision, and then the dynamic range of the final audio mix, leaving viewers needing to reach for the volume control to hear the dialog in quiet scenes, then feel ears battered in the action sequences. The lighting and props would be fine, if this had been released in the 80's or 90's, and if it had been shot on film or one of the film-like digital cameras, instead of the Red listed in the technical details. The dialog isn't poor, it's bland, and it shows in the performances. About the only two places where the production seems to hold a consistent technical standard, is the Smoke Machine Operator, and the Colourist. You don't have to avoid this one, but you're not missing out on anything if you skip it.

This movie raises the bar of truly repulsive movies by an impressive amount. Singlehandedly achieving an honourable First Entry in the List of Horrible Movies! Of course, as someone who has watched a lot of SyFy original movies, I've learned to read between the lines and set my expectations accordingly. So this movie was pretty much exactly what I thought it would be.

It definitely borrows from Alien, The Thing, Dead Space, zombie movies, and generic dystopia. Some actors clearly took their roles too seriously, but several appeared to be having fun chewing the scenery. The story is pretty certain it makes sense, and only a couple times tries to be more than what it is.

If you're wanting some genuine scifi action-adventure, skip the hell out of this one. But if you just want to munch on popcorn and riff on a movie with friends, then this might hit the spot.

Not talking about myself, but about Mr. Willis here. Now you could argue it is just the character he is playing, but you could also argue that it is the role that he made his own - in being quite open about not caring. For better or worse - many here believe for worse. At least he isn't in this for a few seconds, but is actually playing a character.

Maybe the cast convinced him to do a bigger part, maybe producers finally caught up to his deals and made him be longer in a movie than just appear in it. Maybe he liked the Alien rip-off story. I can't say for sure - what I can say is that the movie - well I've seen way worse. I understand if people are dissapointed and I may be giving this too much slack, but I do like the people in front of the camera. And they could've "stolen" from far lesser movies ... at least this looks somewhat good - even if it does feel weird a lot (mostly when Willis is giving other people .. let's call it a hard time, for no apparent reason at all).

If you go with the flow you will be entertained by what you get served here.
