Really bad acting, only Bruce made this movie watchable for me. You need a good director for actors to show their talent, unfortunately they didn't have one in this movie. Kinda low budget (Having like 2 hallways and 5 rooms for the whole movie) but that was the least of the problems.

I thought, Bruce Willis, this will be awesome. How wrong was I. Easily in the top 5 worst movies I have ever seen.

Just when I thought it couldn't get worse, the movie took it as a challenge and it did. I just can't find any redeeming features.

Cliche-ridden from start to finish merging the plot of Alien, the Thing, and every Zombie film ever made, set on a spaceship that looks like the one in Red Dwarf, with similar SFX seen in 1990s TV programmes. I strongly advise avoiding this, which must be Bruce Willis' worst decision.

review_title: Does Space Really Have a Men's Bathroom?
review_detailed_main: What in the name of Olympus did I just watch? This is definitely the worse piece of trash I have ever seen, and I've seen some bad movies! The acting is horrible, the script is terrible, the director is awful, the sets are bad, the whole thing is just bad! I wish I had read the reviews before pressing play. It's 47 minutes (I couldn't even make it through the whole thing it was so bad) I'll never get back. Take my advise and find something else to watch.

review_title: Good God, is it over yet?!?
review_detailed_main:
What a pile of tosh. Honestly one of the worst films I've watched. I must have mis-read when I saw it was No.2 on Netflix, it must have just said it was a pile of No.2!

There were so many flaws in this film, moments where the action clearly didn't match up cut to cut, effects that were horribly cheap, sound that totally ignore the previous cut and a story that doesn't explain itself even when the film comes to an end.

Don't bother watching, I've suffered the 92mins for you!

This film is awful. How Bruce Willis choose this film is beyond me. Kassandra Clementi drags this film down, or is her character written that way? Cody Kearsley only seems to want to bang Kassandra. He's been miscast. It seems that all the cast members whisper their lines. Many times Rachel Nichols acting is non-existent. She could've picked a better film. There's a shootout between the crew and the alien's. She's clearly uncomfortable shooting alien's, Bruce is in his element, and it clearly shows why he's a superstar. The film isn't well written or acted. It's so boring, you could fall asleep. The only time the film really get's going, is near the end. Which makes it worth watching. The ending is intriguing. Don't watch this film because Bruce Willis and Rachel Nichols are in it. It's hideous!
I have no words. Terrible history, production, script, dialogues, actors... I gave up to continue after 30 min.

I think there is a group out there with a hate on for this movie , wouldn't be surprised if most of them didn't even watch it, it's not a great movie but I have seen so many words movies ,and that's just in the last month .

There's nothing wrong with the acting as far as I can see , the script is a little lame sometimes and there's nothing original about it either .

I wasn't that interested from the clip because it seemed same ol same old , but the super bad reviews made me curious . Definitely no worse than.some of the Alien sequels or predator ones and much better than those Doom movies Typical American shoot stuff , blow stuff up , let pretty much everyone die and when a few survive see something that says " It's not over yet"

Willis must be just taking the cash and running, because his last several movies are dreadful. Breach is worse than dreadful. Think of original 1960's Star Trek hand held cameras in near dark with smoke and horrible dialogue. And such a lame B grade alien it is like going back in time to 1950's the blob quality.

review_title: Sunglasses and cigars in a spaceship!
Is this deep fake Bruce Willis? Hope so for him
review_detailed_main: Watched the whole thing then poured bleach in my eyes. By far the worst movie I have seen in years. Did not stop watching either. Wanted to see Bruce embarress himself for the entire length of this terrible high school project.

review_title: So bad that this is my first review...
review_detailed_main:
It's bad. So bad.

The story is bad, the directing is awful, the scenery is probably worst than some school plays, the dialogues are forgettable.

It feels like Bruce Willis did this as a favor, and the some of the other actors did it cause of Bruce. Also, that the director lied to the actors when he said some computer graphics will be applied in post production.

And I gotta say, the worst visual deffects I've seen in a long time. Specially the guns.
Dumb, stupid, lame kind of ripoff of an Alien film. And the dialogue and direction are horrid. As I said in my title: Do not lose 90 minutes of your precious life on this.
Omg just wasted a hour of my life I can't get back.
Better than shawshank. There is nothing else to say.

review_title: How did this movie get Bruce Willis?
review_detailed_main:
Kindergarten level acting, special effects done by Microsoft paint, script that's basically my dog pooping on paper.

99% of this movies budget had to go to Bruce's salary.

I'm trying to think of another way to let you know just how bad this is, but watching it destroyed most of the functioning parts of my brain.

There are plot holes every few minutes, sketchy CGI and every other line is cheesy or makes no sense. If you're looking for a version of 'Alien' that appears to have been made by middle schoolers, then this is for you. I recommend that you spare yourselves the agony of enduring this awful movie.

review_title: I gave it a 5 stars and that's me being generous
review_detailed_main: Ugh this movie was bad. Like it's the kind of movie I'd make on a low budget for a college class. I watched the trailer and figured the cast was good enough for me but it was so painful to watch. The story was bad and predictable. It was only 1.5 hours long but it was painful to watch for 1.5 hours. Like wtf?!?

People were wondering if Bruce Willis needed to pay his taxes or lost a bet or some thing. My guess is he had a crush on that crazy hot chick who spends most of the movie asleep, and he did the movie to try to hook up with her even though she's engaged to another woman.

Because after watching this I have to assume that he would've rather gone to jail than pay his taxes with this drivel. But the dumbest things most men I know have done have been because of a woman. Either that or he needed to buy an organ for himself or one of his loved ones.
It was so bad, I laughed at the monster, because it was so fake.

review_title: Wow... So bad. Very very bad!!
review_detailed_main: The story on its own isn't bad and had this movie been done properly it could have been a decent flick. Unfortunately it wasn't done properly. The acting was horrendous, the production was horrendous, the special effects, if you can call them that, were horrendous and the alien... you guessed it... was horrendous!!!! There was not one redeeming moment in the entire movie. All I can say is that Bruce Willis' standards have hit rock bottom. I used to enjoy his movies but now I have my doubts. Very disappointing.

I tend to be positive but with this film it was unfortunately difficult. The sets and special effects were very low budget, the acting lacked any enthusiasm or emotion, the entire production was so poor it was almost comical..... almost!

This movie is so bad, on so many levels.

Bad writing, bad acting, bad editing, bad special effects, bad audio and music.

So directly derivative of a dozen other movies, full of hackneyed tropes, and awful over acting.

So many plotholes, character inconsistencies, and bad monsters. It is just so awful.

I thought is might be some underground Moldovan or Ukrainian hybrid production, but no there is is "Made in Georgia" USA

This movie looks like an excuse to pay off a bribe, and needed a placeholder as an excuse to produce it, so someone can get paid.

Is Bruce Willis going the way of Rutger Hauer?

Did he lose a lot of money in the Madoff scandal?

How could he stoop so low as to star in this POS?

Something very strange goings on in the production of this movie.
Buckle In For a wild ride. One of the best monsters I've seen in a while. I really like their take on space guns.
Waste of my time that I can never get back. Gave it one star for trying...

review_title: Bruce, you should have stayed home
review_detailed_main: Unbelievable that this movie was produced. Nothing original here and gets worse the more you watch. They ended the movie too late. If you can watch this beyond the halfway mark you must be very bored.

review_title: 92 minutes of my life I'll never get back
review_detailed_main: This movie was called Anti-Life in the UK on Netflix and the name got it right. After watching, I no longer wanted to live 😂 Genuinely awful and the money spent on this film could have been spent elsewhere. The producers should be ashamed they ever got this movie to see the light of day.

Do you need some cash, dude? We can start a GoFundMe if you need funds, because I can NOT imagine why you would ever stick your name and face to something so horrendously awful. If you need money just ask. Take my credit card. Just take my savings. Don't get so desperate you star in embarrassing films and make your fans have it horribly burned into their memories. Seriously, how'd you get from The Fifth Element to this high school grade sci-fi trash? I just can't understand it. Who ever put this at more than 2 stars is trolling, was paid, or worked on it. I had to make an account just to come here and make sure no one watches this. The sheer ridiculousness of it is so awful I'd rather watch Sharknado 20 times in a row than watch "Breach" one more time. The acting, the effects, the stunts, the camera work....all of it....just so so so bad.
Probably the worst movie ever made. Do not watch this pile of crap. Ever.
It's time for him to retire. Earlier movies were fairly good. He's getting old. And just like every picture you ever see of him. The same static pose.

You see the cast.... You say it gives you the curiosity to have a look to the movie. But it seems that they have no budget, no real scenarist. How could so many agents of famous have been so wrong by taking seriously this movie....

This movue is obviously a B-movie, cheaper, less talented, remake of Alien with some very cliched dialogue and plot. The acting is very cheap, as are the ideas. Why did they do it? Who would waste so much talent and energy on something that was much better done already?

I found the movie memerising, for that.

review_title: Awful, maybe trying to be a space Sharknado?
review_detailed_main:
Seemed off right from the beginning, and went straight downhill the whole way. Thought they might be trying to be "bad" like Sharknado... But it was SO BAD, and SO far off the mark, that it's was simply horrible.

How they tricked/convinced so many well known actors into doing this movie, I'll never understand.

Save yourself the time and avoid this movie. It's an hour and 32 minutes of your life you'll never get back.

review_title: 72 minutes I will never get back.
Bruce Willis should appear in a movie with Nicholas Cage
review_detailed_main:
Bruce and Nick must be with the same agents. They are getting as many shoddy acting jobs as possible. This is my fourth movie I have watched with one of them in. Low budget, poor acting, terrible CGI, awful attempt at an Alien movie.

Its meant to be a colony ship with 1000 people in cryo one of the last 4 ships of the human race going to New Earth. Half way through the movie after a few incidents (and still no mention of the sleeping 1000) Bruce's character pipes up "we've got to get off this ship". What about the 1000 poor souls still on it. I managed to get to the 58 minute mark which was pretty good going before turning it off.

Mr Willis appears in the whole movie, 2d facial expressions. At least Mr Cage has the good grace to appear for 3 minutes in his movies before doing a runner with the cash. Also why does Johnny Messner have to be in the same movies Bruce appears in, contractual reasons ? Terrible dont watch not even for curiosity.

review_title: Thomas Jane and Bruce Willis: WHY???
review_detailed_main: One of the worst movies I've ever seen. TJ has no more than 5 minutes screen time in the whole painful hour and 32 minutes. Bruce Willis is still his awesome, sarcastic, badass self, but this flick has zero redeeming qualities.

Given the star names, some of whom have starred in top notch sci fi films and TV shows over the years, we the viewers really deserved better than this. Bruce Willis looks bored and is obviously here just for the paycheck, Rachel Nichols tries I guess while Thomas Jane gurns like he's on a bad drug binge. The sets are cheap, 80s Dr Who looked more convincing, the special effects would look outdated even if they were filmed back in the 80s too. Everyone involved in this should be thoroughly ashamed of themselves.

review_title: Did these actors lose a bet?
review_detailed_main: Horrible movie, stupid characters , only reason I didn't stop watching was that I had it on for background noise.

What did I just watch? This movie looks like it was filmed on the Red Dwarf set. Bruce Willis looks like he rolled out of bed , turned up to set in his dressing gown, shrugged his shoulders , said some lines then went back to bed. This should be shown to potential filmmakers at Universities on how NOT to make a movie. The rest of the poor cast must have taken on their roles just so they could pay their rent this month. This is going to sweep the Razzie Awards.

review_title: John McClane and the Punisher team up and fail to fight off the aliens.
review_detailed_main: Well.... that's and hour and a half of my life that I'll NEVER get back. It actually should have been classified as a comedy because the acting, effects and storyline were just so outrageously comical. I think Thomas Jane made a smart move by allowing his name to be second from the bottom during the credits. Pretty sure Willis and Jane just showed up the day of and were handed the script. They did not act at all, and the remainder of the cast tried to carry the movie. How it has even managed almost 3 stars is actually scary, and shows that some people have depressingly low standards for their entertainment. Pro- tip: avoid this movie like the plague and just watch Alien. I would give this film 0 stars if that was an option. If you are at all still interested in this calamity go read some of the other reviews for the next hour and a half and you would have better entertainment than this film. I feel bad for the people who helped make this film come together because this will follow them forever.
Derivative, pointless drivel. Even Bruce Willis could not save this terrible movie!!

review_title: An absolute joke of a movie that made me consider cancelling my Netflix subscription in protest
review_detailed_main:
As a Sci Fi fan I can enjoy a range of movies from this genre from big budget blockbusters to low budget indies... In fact some of my favourite Sci fi movies are low budget indies which work because they generally have a good story and/or use their budget well...

Now there's Anti-Life/Breach whatever you want to call it...!!! What a complete mess of a movie basically Zero budget for special effects and sets, this movie has put me off giving low budget sci fi movies a chance and as for Bruce Willis.. How far down have you fallen and how hard up are you to even consider a project like this when you use to be able to demand big money....

An absolute joke of a movie that made me consider cancelling my Netflix subscription in protest.

The only plausible explanation for this movie is that Bruce Willis lost a bet and part of the conditions were he had to prank the audience by making this movie. The last 10 seconds were the puked up icing on the putrid, puss-filled cake of a zombies in space movie catastrophe wasted loss of time i will never get back.

The idea of an Alien and Resident Evil mash-up seems cool... but the execution is noooot good. So watch Pandorum instead. Similar plot done much much better.

We only get to hear back story about one character before everyone starts dying. This makes it hard to care that everyone is dying.

There is also a bizarre little sub plot about how people don't think humanity should survive. And honestly from the bleak outlook for humanity (based on the little back story and characters you encounter) im kinda good with that.

This gets 2 stars because of the scene at 1:13. Made me laugh so hard!

review_title: It can only go up from here.
review_detailed_main: Wow just wow.... I mean... Wow this is so bad. Decor looks like spray painted. The shooting, it's like a kid with a stick in his hand doing pew pew pew. The story, facepalm. And the attempt to one liners is just embarrassing. I kinda think alot of famous actors tried to help some 1 in trouble playing this part. Stay clear, don't even try. Just watch the fifth element again or die hard for the 10000 times just don't look at this.

review_title: So bad it's not even funny
review_detailed_main: I was thoroughly disappointed. I wanted it to work and I really tried, but had to give up not even halfway through.

review_title: Send the writer back to school
review_detailed_main:
Where do I start? The script was bursting with 1 liner retorts, but I guess it was an attempt to spice up a storyline conceived at a middle school stoner party.

From the start, the glaring foreshadow with the elongated acid scene to the final line " Let's burn them all down", I was cringing with embarrassment for everyone involved in this production.

I'm sorry.

I came here to see if other people were horrified, not by the sci-fi horror, but by the set, acting, filming etc.

I watched because of Thomas Jane and Bruce Willis. When the movie ended I was just completely disgusted. I hope they were at least laughing their buns off during the filming, because the joke was on us.
I'd rather sit and stare at one frame of a ridley Scott sci fi movie for design and production value than watching this entire awful movie. Really don't bother.

If you saw BW on the street hungry for food. Would you chip him $5..?

Save ur money. Save your time. Save yourselves. Avoid this monstrosity.

Bad plot, bad sets, bad effects, bad acting, bad everything. Don't watch this film. I'm never getting this 1h 32m back and I'm worse for it...

I feel sorry for Bruce Willis. John 'doesn't die hard' McClane, Hudson Hawk, Butch 'you go down in the 5th' Coolidge, mr. Korben Dallas, Frank 'redirect extremely dangerous' Moses FFS... And now this...? Please don't do movies like this again, Bruce. Pretty please with sugar on top...

review_title: I love a good B movie but this is painful to watch
review_detailed_main: As mentioned I love a good B movie. However Anti Life is appallingly bad. It's dreadful. I very seldom wrote poor reviews but feel I need to to save people from this atrocity. Save some of your life and avoid this like the plague. Willis is clearly bored, other actors just ham it up. Rubbish story, rubbish sets. Rubbish special effects. By far the highlight of this movie is the end cedits and they don't come quickly enough.

review_title: I created an account just to say how bad this is!
review_detailed_main:
Only created an account just to write this review as this film is truly terrible and to tell you not to waste 90 minutes of your life!

This is going to be one of those films that keeps coming up in the top 10 lists of films that killed the actors career or worst performing or something.

I honestly could of counted the little stones that have fallen to the ground from the pebble dashing on my house and had more fun!

I would of given it 0 star's if I could!
This movie is almost as bad as the grammar of my fellow reviewers, it's THAT terrible.
There are bad movies, even terrible movies, and then there is this.
Oh sweet unmerciful film gods it was not....that was supposed to be a real sci-fi film. It wasn't even campy fun. Ughh can't unsee Seriously HARD PASS.

Great plot executed with terrible writing, acting, special effects and pretty much everything else. There's no explanation for literally anything that happens. New earth is saved by a disgraced admiral turned janitor. It's Under Siege, the discounted space version.

review_title: Probably the worst film ever, and I think was meant to be a serious sci-fi thriller
review_detailed_main:
It's rubbish.

The admiral had borrowed Stallones dark glasses from Cobra and wore them inside addressing the passenger, no doubt to give them confidence in his bad assness. They also let he sleep in the cryo during the crisis, he must have needed the rest.

The alien was taken straight from Red Dawrf, but an early episode with really bad (not so) special effects. In fact, the alien was created out of the same stuff as Morph.

I've seen better acting in a garden full of gnomes.

Bruce, the bad ass, was standing there in disarray as it all kicks off.

Fun fact, you can't kill this alien with bullets.... But use a cleaning product, that should do the trick.

Bruce is in trouble... We should set up a GoFundMe page to help him out.

The movie is just laughably bad (and not in the fun way.)

He's really just hopping around collecting paychecks, isn't he? After watching Cosmic Sin and now this I am simply giving up. I'm skipping future movies with Bruce.

Honestly one of the worst movie ever. King before anything start happening. Halfway through you start believing it's an ok movie and then the end.... The end is just horribly stupid and doesn't make any sense. Please don't waste your time.

review_title: Willis is not a lead roll...
review_detailed_main:
Sadly I have to agree with many others. CGI was terrible but that wasn't the worst part, the characters ...

Sometimes actors do things for money, as a favour to a friend, to boost someone else's career, or to just do something they haven't been cast for in the past. If you are drawn to this movie for Bruce Willis, you should pass, because my prior statement is how I felt half way through this movie. Felt like a cameo of a character to hate, and usually Willis is not a character to hate.

The rest of the goings on in space weren't worth commenting on because they were sadly very lack luster for the time and effort everyone involved must have taken to make it.

I have watched thousands of movies and I just have not brought myself to finish this one yet...

review_title: Uuuuummmmmmmmmmm?!?! Yes, we just sat through the whole thing honey!
review_detailed_main:
Wow! It's obviously bad when my wife (who sits through all sorts of b - rated sci-fi movies) asks me, did we seriously watch that whole movie? Yes dear, we sat here and couldn't look away from the train wreck.

Honestly, I don't feel bad for BW, if he's that hard up for money, that's his own fault. I feel bad for Thomas Jane, the star of one of my favorite all time movies, The Punisher! At least his role was short in this train wreck, low budget, laugh fest of a "movie?"

This horrible sci fi movie was another in a recent long line of schlock movies that Bruce Willis has lent his name to in order to keep those paychecks coming. It contains a tidal wave of bad writing, bad special effects, and bad cliches. Add to it a small part of an intergalactic admiral, played by Thomas Jane (also seeking an easy paycheck?), and you have the makings of a disaster of a disaster movie.

I will leave it to other reviewers to point out the list of flaws and stupidity, but at some point we can only hope that Bruce Willis will take on a script where he can redeem himself as an actor, and take back his self respect.

review_title: Glad I watched it only to come here and read the reviews
review_detailed_main:
Literally crying with laughter.

This film is AWFUL. But the reviews are amazing.
Honestly, what a terrible movie. Then, when you think it can't get any worse, it does! But wait. It's not over. It gets worse.

review_title: Poor story line, bad acting and bad special effects
Have not watched, but eh comments
review_detailed_main: Has Bruce outdone himself from Cosmic Sin. I would like to know before spending 90 minutes. 1 star everywhere. That should be a give away.

review_title: Less than the sum of its parts
review_detailed_main:
A plot that's been done 100s of times can't be saved by acting that tries to bring it some life.

While there's nothing wrong with telling an old story, the writing and pace of this film, simple camera and lackluster audio make the overall experience predictable.

To its credit, it does tell a story, and makes it through an awkward script...

It's like an extended episode of the BBC's Red Dwarf except Red Dwarf is actually funny on purpose. A really terrible, terrible film that will make you laugh out loud because it's so bad.

The special effects would have looked bad even in the 80's, the acting is poor and the script and continuity felt like a kid was in charge. No idea what Bruce Willis was thinking but I bet he cringes whenever he remembers he starred in this.

Should never have made this movie. HOW did they get Bruce Willis on this? Truly unbelievable. Everything from costumes to set design, acting to writing is the worst EVER. Nothing is good about this film. Space zombies who aren't even interesting or scary. Characters you dont care about doing things that dont make sense at all. Its stupid. And boring. And nothing about it is even remotely worth one minute of your time. Kept waiting for it to get better...never did. Watching water boil is better than this movie. Period.

I got to the point where this actually made me want to just watch something, anything else. It had some decent actors so I thought it would get better. Wrong. It just got worse and worse until the lamest ending ever. Ed Wood made better movies.
After paying Bruce's salary, they had about 1000 dollars left I think. Worst film ever.....

review_title: It looks like is BAD on PURPOSE!!
review_detailed_main: I created an account just to rate it. I wish there was a half star rating. This will be it.

Yes it was cheesy, and yes the CG was bad but honestly it wasn't the worst movie of all time. Have any of you seen Battlefield Earth? Now that's really garbage.

Take this for face value. No background story, cheap thrills but not bad. I enjoyed it and expected a lot worst. If your bored give it a try.

I would love to know what happened during the filming and production of this film because it is completely broken. It's obviously had re-edits. There are sections where it's clear that whole scenes have been removed. Really weird editing and jumps. The set looks worse than early Red Dwarf but with none of the cheap charm. The special effects are horrible. I wouldn't criticise the acting because the dialogue makes a good performance impossible. I actually wouldn't give the film-makers and performers that hard a time because it's clear something somewhere went very badly wrong and that may have been out of their control. The awfulness makes no sense otherwise. I would actually recommend watching it in a way, because although it's not 'funny bad' like The Room it is grimly fascinating as a car crash.

review_title: 21st Century version of Plan 9 From Outer Space
review_detailed_main: A world class collection of clichés, wooden acting, cheesy effects, and amateur script writing. You need to be drunk with a bunch of friends to laugh this one through. Otherwise put the popcorn down and back away from the remote. This is the one movie Bruce Willis really dies in ...

It's more like a parody of a Bruce Willis movie. Can't say more than what's been said here. From the premise, to the effects, to the set, to the acting, truly a dog of a film. I stopped it several times to watch TikToks instead. Eventually finished it because I'm no quitter. :-)
If your read only one review on here let it be this. AVOID!

review_title: It put a smile on my face.
review_detailed_main: I think the guns & some of the set was made from Lego. I've seen worse movies, at least it made me laugh.

When I watched the Roast of Bruce Willis he was getting razzed for all the bad movies he's done. But I remember thinking that he didn't make that many awful movies.

Then I watched this.

It's like Attack of the Killer Tomatoes, except at least that movie knew what it was doing.

Unoriginal, predictable and the script is a copy/paste of every space based horror film that has ever been made. Should be used in media courses as a prime example of how not to make a film. Only one reason worth watching is to see how many cliches you can spot. Ridley Scott should sue the producers for copyright infringement.
The worst one, sorry for bruce, sorry for my time.

review_title: 14 minutes of my life I'll never get back...
review_detailed_main:
I mean, what's left to say that the other 1/10 ratings haven't already said. I made it about 15 mins in before I realized either my dog went potty in the house or this movie was just that bad. Bruce Willis lost a poker game, probably similar to the poker game in Titanic to agree to be in this. I got to the part where the, commander, or whoever the guy in charge was doing his best gravelly deep scratchy Batman impression and I had to turn it off.

Just bad......
Terrible movie. It doesn't matter how good you are at suspending disbelief, this movie and the acting is just awful. Even Bruce does a terrible job.

review_title: A new low point has been set.
review_detailed_main: If you are drunk enough this could be seen as a comedy.
The history is taken in 2242 and the spaceship ticket is printed in paper?

I saw the user 3.0 rating. But, stuck in a flight having seen all else, I decided to say screw it and watch anyway. Then I weakened, and watched the trailer. I couldn't even watch that. When the trailer is so bad...maybe find a movie I just saw last week a much better plan. Bruce, people are talking.

Bruce Willis didn't care about this film and neither did I. Only problem was he got paid for it and I had to pay to watch it. I don't mind the old 80s monster films but this was just another "in space" rip off. Poor acting, dialogue and script...

I like sci-if and I like Mr. Willis. This movie? Not so much. Typical Mr. Willis character and he was the only actor that didn't totally suck. Mr. Kreaey was a joke. Like as bad as Mr. Christensen in Star Wars. This story was lack luster and there was not a thrill to be had. If it wasn't for Mr. Willis, I would not have even finished it.

review_title: I want a refund on my electricity bill!
review_detailed_main:
First the good... it was finally over.

The bad... everything!

I thought I had seen it all, but this film really takes the biscuit. The special effects were disastrous. The sets were flimsy - you could see "solid" items flex.

I laughed a lot. You have to.

In fact, I wish there was the option to rate this as a negative ten stars.

Finally... Mr. Willis, please, please, I beg of you, do not make a film like this again - ever!
Sorry Bruce but what were you thinking . You're a better actor that this . This is absolutely terrible . Gave it a one for old time sake .

review_title: Normally i don't write reviews, this i a warning... much to bad to see !

review_detailed_main: Awful story, even worse acting. And let's not even start on the CGI. A definite one to miss.

review_title: Someone cashed in on a favor owed to them by Bruce Willis
review_detailed_main: Sometimes I watch a poorly rated movie just too say it's not THAT bad, I've seen worse. This is THAT bad. Bruce Willis isn't this hard up for money and even if he were, he still wouldn't put his name on this unless there was a distinct and purposeful reason. Impressively bad. Wow.
Who blackmailed Bruce Willis? This was the worst movie I've every seen. Wow. Terrible in every way.

I'm over 50 and have seen loads of films in my life.

This just might be the worst!

This movie is so SO bad. I don't get it. How can a movie this bad be made in this day & age? Please don't waste your time. You'll never get it back, plus you'll have the images from this horrible movie ingrained in your memory.
I only created a IMDb account to give this movie 1 star because it's the most garbage sci fi movie I have seen in my life.

review_title: This is so beneath Bruce Willis - he must be desparate
Bruce Willis must be up to something
review_detailed_main: Bruce has been turning out some real stinkers lately from phoning it in to semi comatose and now this thing. Even if you don't take it seriously, it's still one of the worst productions I have ever had the misfortune to endure. I guess they blew the entire budget on Bruce and then relied on friends and family to put the sets together and doodle the cgi. I almost want to cancel my Netflix in protest! So bad that it's prompted me to write my first review.
Please give me my time back - this is on par with The Room but worse...it's not entertaining at all.

review_title: Believe the wisdom of the crowd
review_detailed_main: I read a page or two of reviews of this, and then watched the movie all the way through more out of curiosity than anything. Surely Bruce Willis wouldn't make a movie as bad as the reviewers said? He did.

review_title: B-movie with Epic actors, quite fun
review_detailed_main:
The film itself is a collection of plagiarism, I don't know, 50 different films? Bad visuals, bad staging create a comedic effect. It would be cool if they did it on purpose, but no. The only thing that piques interest is cool actors like Thomas Jane, Timothy Murphy and so on. Callan Mulvey and Bruce Willis look great on confrontation before the fight scenes .. uh .. it's like a school YouTube video. Very bad visuals of shooting, flames, monsters, explosions. I've seen homemade videos of the same or better quality.

Maybe if they focused on the genre of deconstruction with small but high quality effects, it would be a great movie.

Breach, or Ant-Life, whatever it's called...has no redeeming qualities...at all.

The story doesn't make sense, the first 30 minutes of the film absolutely nothing happens while the dialogue that was supposed to establish character ties was a random disjointed mess.

While the scenes were semi-coherent the actors tried to perform, but at some point, everybody gave just gave up.

Bruce also looked like he was having fun, but he got bored even faster than I did.

And I'm not saying that the film is bad because they did not have the budget to do good CGI muzzle flashes, no.

It's just only boring. Not intentionally funny or entertaining, not full of action or tension.

For some reason, they also found it funny to insert occasional Alien references and even full scenes, seeing those really hurt me.

I won't say they did not try, but this is clearly the case of "this looked so much better on paper" or "oh, this is how it turned out?".

Bruce Willis is Old. Bruce should retire. Bruce should quit trying to relive his one great glory day on his only great movie Blade Runner. Bruce hasn't been good for thirty going on forty years or whatever year Blade Runner was made. He wasn't even the lead actor in his own sequel. Did I mention Bruce Willis is Old?

How old is Bruce Willis?

1. Bruce is older grew up on black and white movies with no sound.

2. Bruce once met Jesus seating olives in a carpentry seminar.

3. Bruce planted the first vineyard in Eden.

4. When Bruce writes it can be in Summerian.

5. Bruce booed Copernicus at a Catholic hearing as a flat Earther.

Bruce is too old for making movies that are multiple decade old imitations of Aliens with much better actors like Seguorney Williams. And much uglier than her. I could barely watch the trailer of Breach. Apparently Bruce can't let his ego retire him to the local country club of ancient has been, washed up, actors on his millions he's worth. Unless he's broke thsnks to his former cheating wife Dimmy More who seduces very young men in the up and coming actor world.

Breach is a sad tale of talentless writers, poor directors and trashy imitations and bad actors which Hollywood is always doing to satisfy the low morals and desires of movie going peons and Hollywood greed (Rings if Power for example).

D.

OMFG. Bruce Willis is an actor that a director has to know how to use to get the best out of. He has the acting chops, comic timing, and a star-quality presence, but to get an audience to buy what Willis is selling, the director has to package it right. This director couldn't wrap a Rubik's cube, let alone a complex beast like Willis, and he clearly couldn't afford a gift bag in which to hide his lack of packaging skills. Hence, Willis comes off as a cheap cardboard cutout, on which the film unfortunately blew the majority of its budget.

Thrown in with a discount-store 'junior Colin Farell and Jodie Foster knockoff Chinese Action Figurine' value pack, Willis doesn't even phone it in. In fact, I'm not sure if he even could be gifted with a generous "he texted it in". Thomas Jane gets off lightly by spending the great majority of the film in cryosleep - he may be able to wash off his association with this fetid puddle of space horror trope-vomit, given enough time.

This film lacks any originality, and is so mono-dimensional that any (possible?) attempt to tip its hat to the genre's greats telegraphs desperation, not pizzaz. The sets look like an elementary school cardboard diorama, and nothing is done to meaningfully disguise its low-budget nature. Foley frequently neglects to mask hollow, wooden clunks and thuds on walls and surfaces that should be metal. Lighting is flat and atmosphere-destroying (I've seen better-lit budget 1990s cable soap operas). Colour grading seems to favour uneven, generic "point and shoot" settings. Special effects are, well, bad. Some of the monster stuff is actually ok when hidden in the mist, but the ships and space scenes are worse than budget Dr who ships from the 70s, and effects such as muzzle flare look painted in with 80s paintbox technology.

I not sure what this film thinks it is, but it isn't. Urgh. Raw sewage.
Bruce Willis cashes a paycheck and gets 2nd billing to a stiff for his "effort". Rachel Nichols shows us once again the she is way past her "sell by date". Other than that the movie is horrible.

This is, perhaps, the worst movie I've ever seen.

Every single scene in this movie is bad from top to bottom. Like, every shot within every scene is bad. There is not a 15 second sequence that goes by in this movie that couldn't be torn apart. The writing, the acting, the cinematography, it is all god-awful. I have no idea how this movie got made.

I almost rated this movie a 2/10 instead of a 1/10 because I was actually impressed at how consistently terrible it managed to be, but I realized that if any movie deserves the 1/10; it's this one.

"Everyone on Earth is dead. But look on the bright side , they're serving pancakes today " Don't know what happened after that line ( by Bruce Willis ) as I switched off.

Worst movie ever made avoid at all costs.

Avoid avoid avoid

review_title: Feels cheap and forced despite solid lead cast.
review_detailed_main:

The acting of the people mentioned was fine, perhaps a couple of more people put an effort also. Since there is little CGI i guess it's fine also. Same with the environment, and decorations. The rest of the movie is bad.

The plot is terrible, the motives and actions of people are idiotic, the villain and monsters are virtually flat. At times this movie feels like a parody, as none of the jokes, or conversations were executed well.

It just feels cheap on almost all levels. And it's a shame really, because if some of the scenes would have been deleted, a better monster was chosen with some suspense added - this could have been a "pandorum" lookalike.

In general I cannot recommend this to anyone except those few who are hardcore fans of Bruce Willis. All of the rest should avoid this movie.

With better writing, more suspense and less stupid and forced action this could have been watchable as at times it does feel like a horror movie. However for the most part it's neither scary nor fun to watch. I give it 4 and it's only out of the respect for the leading actors. That's how bad this movie is. Unfortunately that is.

review_title: Trying to figure out why they made this film
review_detailed_main:
I wonder if they didnt crap this stinker out during 2020, or maybe it was in the can in 2019 and it just wasnt worth releasing until a viral pandemic trapped everyone inside.

Your typical affair. The ship is overrun by aliens, and if we dont do something soon, everyone will die. Fortunately for the costume and makeup team, the aliens are zombies, and the zombies are people who ate too much black licorice.

They did a little better on the ship interior. Except it's pretty clear they only made one room, and one L-shaped hallway. Towards the climax, we see the zombie aliens attain their final form, and this must be the entire special effects budget, because by the end of the film, we've got some kind of stop motion 1933-King Kong lookin garbage, englarged with MS-Paint, and greenscreened into the background under a layer of dense fog.

True to form, our heroes never seem to discover any way to kill the zombliens. There's several obvious options they ignore in favor of shooting nerf guns at them (props guy couldn't afford some black spray paint?). Which has the same effect as always when you shoot a zombie in the torso with so many BB-gun rounds.

The things is a mess from start to finish, and I'm just shaking my head, trying to find out how the director or lead is related to Bruce Willis that he volunteered to be in this.
Who did this?? I still cannot believe how horrible is this movie? What is wrong with you people?!

Why... Why did I waste 1.5hr of my life watching this? Why did my family waste 1.5hr of there lives watching this? Why did Bruce Willis agree to do this film? Why was the film even made and released?

Why?

Bruce Willis plays a down and out drunk. Demoted from the big leagues and ending up working in toilets... That is just how he ended up in this role. Bruce... I am deeply ashamed of you for having accepted a role in this pathetic drivel. I would assume that Bruce Willis was cast because his fee was far lower than the cost of having to produce something credible and worth watching plus advertising. People see Bruce Willis's face and get reeled in.

Whilst Bruce Willis managed to play to his usual acting standards, the rest of the cast appeared to have been expelled from a 3rd rate acting school for bad grades. The budget seemed to be almost enough to cover the storyline which in of itself wasn't overly horrendous, however, whoever was in charge of the execution should be banned from working in the entertainment industry for life.
From opening scene to end, it was low budget B movie.

REVIEW - BREACH

In Breach, "Fleeing a devastating plague on Earth, an interstellar ark comes under attack from a new threat; a shape-shifting alien force intent on slaughtering what is left of humanity."

But.......

What could have been a good film was actually spoilt by......

Someone, somewhere, should dare to watch all of the direct-to-VOD stuff Willis has churned out in the last few years and marvel at how an actor who can be really great sometimes, if he cares to, just seems to be sleepwalking through this latter-half of his career and this one thing just makes you think why am I ever bothering to watch if he can't be bothered.

Some great performances by the other cast but a wasted opportunity.

Rating 3 out of 10

There are some many other ways of wasting my life. Maybe I will try to run the Cyberpunk 2077 on my PS3 to recover after this movie.
Nothing has happened yet ...so instead of wasting 2 hours....I'd though I'd read some reviews. Ok...thanks !

This film should be used as an example for some film class. Budget special effects and sets aside, this film fails on so many different levels. The writing is bare bones soulless drivel, but that's pretty typical among these low rent scifi movies. To make the poorly paced writing worse, however, is some absolutely awful editing. The first 30 minutes of the movie feels like someone went at it with a chainsaw, leaving you wondering if you dozed off and missed something. It's possible that the script alone may have been merely bad if it had decent editing, rather than truly awful. The walls are papered with flat characters that serve nothing more than to become fodder later. Character motivations are flimsy at best. The camera work is at times passable, and at times seem like someone forgot they were operating a camera. Color grading ranges from jarring and off putting to "I recognize that preset". It's so predictable I could have told you the ending at the 30 minute mark. It's entirely forgettable. I just finished watching it about 10 minutes ago and already can't remember any of the character's names.

This film basically offers nothing memorable or noteworthy, not even brainless action fun. A solid skip in my book. If it's on someone else's dime, perhaps it may be worth the time investment if you just need some background noise.

Props: piano hinges and laminated particle board for 'Future Cryogenic Chambers'?! What in the Hell is Bruce Willis getting for this . . . 98% of the budget?! Cause there wasn't ANY budget spent on sets, editing, production, script, props, script, ANYTHING.

Did someone read this script for Bruce and he just trusted their judgement or was he drunk when he agreed. The only other option i can think of is that he ran over some dudes dog and agreed to star in his film to make up for it.

The idea could have been good but the execution was terrible. They clearly struggled for investment and ended up having to make the film on a budget of about $12 because the props look like they were bought from toys'r'us or found in the skip at universal studios and the CGI appears to have been done by a high school kid on his iPhone.

I'm embarrassed for the actors involved in this project and as a piece of advice to the production team, I'm all for following your dreams but when investors are laughing at you and asking you to be removed from the office (As i assume happened for you guys...) then maybe you should question whether it really is a good idea to inflict you abortion of a movie onto the world...

And if you do, I am officially telling you right now ahead of time;

I TOLD YOU SO!
This movie was 100% terrible I honestly was hopping it was a joke. I was laughing when they were shooting the blue guns and moving them to make it look like they where shooting lmao wow

This movie is not bad but entertaining, it's actually just really really bad. Please do yourself a favor and skip it.

What are ya doin Brucey?!

review_detailed_main:
This was shockingly bad. No character development at all. Only watched because Bruce Willis was in it. He just phoned it in. Didnt recognize any of the other actors. The acting wasn't even B level. Doubt you'll see any of them in a quality move. It was painful to watch.

The film is terrible. Bad special effects, terrible props. The worst thing of all is the absolutely appalling script with actors like Bruce Willis not even bothering to act. Please don't waste your time I wish I hadn't.

Sad to see Bruce Willis who has fallen from the heights of Die Hard and The Sixth Sense to starring in drivel like this.

Poor plot, well what there was of it, so much so I turned away in disgust. Bruce looked like he was being held at gunpoint while delivering his lines. Mix of fear and shame of having to act in the film equivalent of root canal with no anaesthetic.

I can honestly say please don't waste your precious time on this. Its filmmaking at its very worst. I would rip my cable box out and burn it before I would allow this on my TV again!

review_title: Colossal waste of time. Can't believe Bruce Willis agreed to doing this film!!
review_detailed_main: Holy crap.... this was utterly ridiculous. I rarely ever write reviews for movies, but I was compelled to spread the word about how just plain horrible this one was... I am a huge fan of Bruce Willis which is why I stuck it out for the entire duration, but I just can't believe he took a movie like this. I think the budget for this entire film was like $15 bucks. I wish I could rewind time and never watch this train wreck. Someday many years from now I'm going to be laying on my death bed wishing I had never wasted my precious time on such a disaster of a movie... I just can't stop thinking about how bad this was... it's like I need to wash it down with something else.
First Cosmic Sun and then this disaster of a movie. Bruce is 2 for 2 in the "why was this made?" horrible sci-fi movie category.

All the other reviews are pretty spot on. This is a sub par zombies in space B movie with at cast and CGI that baffles me. I had to watch it all the way through cringing and laughing with a couple friends until the predictable and sad ending. So bad.

This movie makes you appreciate the quality of production we take for granted in 99.99% of everything else.

1 star because its' so bad. 1 more star because I was somewhat entertained.

This is an honest opinion and recommendation to anyone that holds Bruce Willis high in their minds.

This movie will make your eyes tear up and you will regret forever that you let yourself get sucked into watching another action movie with Bruce Willis, in hope of getting some John McLane magic in a space environment.

Sadly this is anything but a watchable movie for anyone, except the deaf-blind.

The plot is as much a steal from any other space-traveling-repopulation movie that has ever been made, but without any kind of script that has an interest in making you understand anything other than; Monsters bad - good guys try to shoot monsters with bullets - monsters are like zombies and don't care - monsters infect more - good guys get infected - monsters transform into something else - good guys feel the need to escape ....

Well you get the picture.
Low budget Space Zombie flicking Bruce Willis with bad special effects

review_title: Not quite as bad as the majority of reviews suggest.
review_detailed_main:
It's a cheesy retro-feeling sci-fi/monster movie with acting and atmosphere to match, and within that sub-type it's pretty ok (though I'm certainly not an aficionado of the genre), but unfortunately it does come with a couple of major flaws; the obviously very very light effects budget, and the ending, which was to me very unsatisfying.

I don't have a problem with movies going light on the effects if they decide to focus the efforts elsewhere, thing is this is the kind of movie where decent effects are important and could have lifted it up (not saying they would have needed top tier stuff, but the effects in this movie are on the very light side even comparing to similar 80s or 90s movies).

I have tried to rate it objectively within it's genre, and I went back and forth between 4 and 5, ultimately I let my subjective opinion be the tiebreaker and landed on 4, because this isn't really the kind of movie I enjoy, I just watched it because of curiosity.

I think one of the problems with the low reviews might be that when people see Bruce Willis name on it they will expect a higher tier of movie (just a guess), but if you go in to this prepared, I think it's a decent enough 88 minute distraction.

review_title: A bunch of movies in one.
review_detailed_main:
Well this was certainly not worth the price of admission. But at least we got to watch a bunch of good movies turned into one bad movie without changing the channel. First we got Passengers, then we got Alien and finally we got The Thing. Although it was great that we got to see what a space version of the Walking Dead would look like. LOL

But on the plus side it was only 93 minutes long although, those 93 minutes seemed longer than tun time for The Greatest Story Ever Told.

I'm sorry but Bruce Willis has become the definition of "has been" and I wait with bated breath for his next debacle because this movie made that other dog of his Cosmic Sin seem academy award worthy.

review_title: Who was the weapons guy on this?
review_detailed_main: Really this is so bad! Who was the weapons guy on this? The girls M16 Carry handle was installed backward!

The story is just about half baked. Borrowed from Alien it didn't even scare, it was as if a film studies student had made a film to think that Bruce Willis even bothered with this he obviously just needed the money.

This is by far the worst movie I think I've seen in years. Not even laughable. I need to go check if M Night Shambles had anything to do with this cluster F. Effects were soooooo baaaaaad.

To make matter worse, the graphics/special effects were something you'd expect back in 2005.

Decent idea, poor acting, and even worse execution.

review_title: One of the WORST Bruce Willis' movies ever made

The story isn't the worst, it's just been done before and infinitely better. The rest of the movie is dire. It feels like they tried to make a movie that was a tutorial on what makes a bad movie. There's a couple of bits of acting in the bland script. Characters are generic. Graphics are 1970's level, added to the dire production and editing it feels older and worse. The metal doors flapping about, the dead guy breathing, almost visible light bulb just outside the window, it's all just a bit tacky. The editing or lack of available scenes is criminal. The ending is painfully terrible.

I like a good bad movie that has something to offer, this has no such feature. I can't think of one reason to recommend this which is absolutely absurd.

review_title: Bruce was the only good part really.
review_detailed_main:

I wouldn't recommend the movie unless you're looking for a corny cringy 93 minutes.

It looks really cheap, the beginning was dire... I've seen better effects on drag race.

I can't really comment on the acting because I only managed 10 minutes. Think horror channel on a Tuesday probably 1am.
Total BS. Possibly the worst movie ever. Bad acting, Bad writing, Bad everything.

Well even Spaceships have to have cleaners....lol... I like this movie as it gives me hope that I can get an A lister to act in my movie. Think Red Dwarf without comedy in a 3 set badly lit studio, with a terrible script and Space Slugs!! I can see what they were trying to do, they just don't pull it off. I dare say it's not the actors, they did the best with what they had, it's the camerawork. Which is down to the Directing...you see in something like this, there's no need to see the set because it's just the same dull grey/green flat lighting everywhere, you need pools of light to give dark corners, tight, fast, wobbly, whip pan, out of focus shots to give suspense and a feeling of dread. Instead we get static midshot cut to midshot continuously. It's dreadful. There's also no atmosphere and little to no music. With a better Director this could have worked but as is the Director needs to go back to film school and hand in his badge. This isn't his only dull flop of a movie, it seems he specialises in them. Avoid.

review_title: Don't believe all the 1/10s This movie is a 0.
review_detailed_main: I managed 8 mins. Bruce used to be one of the best but now he's a zero! Hopefully he got paid the big bucks for this big piece of rubbish. Good luck to him.

While the 1 reviews are too harsh, it is indeed pretty bad.

The acting was fine, but the dialogue was cheesy at best most of the time.

There are some good scenes, and some decent suspense, it all too frequently cringeworthy and boring.

A lot of missed opportunities that would have made this better. More human, make more of it more suspenseful. Critters never really jumped out. Mostly telegraphed.

I did like the ending. But, I mostly regret watching it. Bruce was pretty good in a poorly written role.

Supporting actors were mostly good, but the Stanley part was overacted, and Jane hammed it up a bit as well. Others were surprisingly solid.

I am almost speechless for mixed feelings of surprise.

I felt like I was watching a horror from the 1980's with inexperienced actors and actresses.

The story in itself is good, however the execution leaves much to be desired.

The acting is painful; everyone made feel they were aware of the camera rolling, very unnatural moves, gestures, even voices/sounds.

Often the scenes are too dark to see anything, now I can't decide whether it's a good thing or a bad one.

The effects are very amateur, be it the alien killing blue firegun or the spaceship, even the injury on Bruce Willis's head.

The monster time-travelled roughly 35 years into its future.

On the positive side, if you're into the '80's horrors, cliches, quick fixes, spaceship interiors and effects, this is your movie.

There's many good actors in this movie sadly a low budget movie. Special effects were terrible dialogue was horrendous. When I saw that Bruce Willis was in this I expected a better movie but I was very much mistaken. Not a movie I would recommend to anyone unless there's absolutely nothing else to pass the time with.so I've rated this movie a 4star because of the actors.the ending of the movie was totally ridiculous basically if I'd have gone to the cinema to see this I would have asked for my money back. I truly can not believe that Bruce Willis was in this. He must have been desperate for money.

review_title: I left with more questions than when I started
review_detailed_main:
I found this after it was reviewed in Red Letter Media's Youtube video on Bruce Willis' declining career, so I know why Bruce chose to do so many B-movies, because he knew his only money earning career was about to end and said yes to everything. This thing is so lazily written and acted it wishes it was a B-movie.

I have so many questions about this movie that were never explained.

What is the extinction event that forced people to leave Earth?

How did they locate a New Earth, and how did they find the technology to get there, yet don't have the technology to end whatever was going to make the Earth population extinct?

How did the planet get to a population of 19 billion and still be sustainable during the last 2 centuries without wasting all of Earth's resources with billions dying from it?

Why does a spaceship whose only purpose is to transit passengers in cryo-stasis need janitors?

Why is the concentrated cleaning liquid made of acid so strong it can eat through metal, yet no one tells the janitor it could eat through his skin while doing his job?

Why are the crew still drinking beer in glass bottles over 300 years after they were invented? How many empty bottles are they expecting to get through for the whole crew in 6 months, and where are they going to store them all?

Why does everyone on the crew look so old and close to death when they are meant to be the last and best of the human population?

Why does discount Viggo Mortensen have a huge scar on his face, and how bad does society become if they can't heal a scar 222 years from when this movie was made?

Why is it illegal to make moonshine on the ship, yet the commanders of the ship are aware of this and do nothing about it?

Why did 3 men who had cornered a guy with guns allow the guy to kill someone before they even start shooting at him?

Why at 52:26 in does Bruce Willis go from talking, to a wide shot of him standing there with his mouth closed?

Why does Bruce's character use a flame thrower when they clearly know there's a fire suppression system that's going to shoot gas at them from the ceiling because one person knows it's operational, yet weren't prepared for it and then have to be told to cover their eyes?

Why does the fire system only work once in one area of the ship, and not at any other time when Bruce is using his flame thrower?

Why does the plan of the air duct system look like a screensaver from Windows 98?

The only reason to watch this is if you wanted to see one of Bruce's final roles before he retires with his illness, or if you wanted to make a drinking game out of this, say every time a person attacks someone, every time someone dies, every time Bruce forgets what emotion is. Otherwise, don't waste your time.

It was so boring that I considered turning it off after 10 minutes, but I'm a completist so I kept it on in the background to see what other wacky things would happen.

If you must, watch it on Youtube for free, it's definitely not worth paying for.
Bruce Willis needed some money or he lost a bet; otherwise i have no explanation. Just don't waste your time; i watch a lot of SF but this goes to my top 5 worst.

Bruce Willis is really slumming it lately, the once sought after action hero is reduced to appearing in numerous b movies and this one isn't the worst he's done but it's pretty close. We've ruined our planet earth, once again (how many movies is this now?) And are traveling millions of miles to another planet with the name new earth. There's an alien being on board,put there by someone on the crew unhappy with the destruction of earth, and leaving it behind with people dying of a plague. The hokey one liners kept me watching and by the end I was laughing at the giant monster the alien had turned into. So I guess I half enjoyed it? More of a comedy than sci-fi horror.

I was so wow when saw a poster for a new SF movie and plus Mr. Willis there... but sadly this movie is one those You will forget very fast...or remember it as a one of those movies that shouldnt be filmed at all. Mr. Willis was good as usuall You can see his experience in every sceene but many other things were wrong and bad. This is kind of zombie sf movie with stupid end. I dont recommend it.
Bruce Willis must have lost a bet this was worse that Sharknado 5

review_title: Worst film I've watched in as long as I can remember
review_detailed_main: The lighting is terrible, the camera work is terrible, the story doesn't make any sense at all, the sets are a joke, the acting is a joke... So let's keep this simple, whoever allowed this utter garbage to be released should be sacked immediately. End of review.
This is so bad, Smoking and drinking in the 23th century. In DIY scene's. The Cryo cages we did replay the movie to watch it. We could not believe what we saw. Why Bruce, why.

review_title: JUST DREADFUL ()but I had to watch it until the end)
review_detailed_main:
Bruce, what are you doing in such a third rate move....again. He totally phoned in this performance. Not good at all.

Thomas Jane - wearing sunglasses inside a spaceship is just a total tool move. Just a dumb role really.

The acting was subpar and honestly, that guy, Timothy V Murphy, jesus. He screams at people in what I assume is supposed to be an Army type manner but honestly, he just made me want to tell him to STFU. THE most dreadful yelling voice I've ever heard. JUST SHUT UP TIMOTHY, no-one needs to hear that s#!t !!

This was a dreadfully cheap movie. Badly acted, ridiculous goings on. Honestly, firing machine gun like devices INSIDE a spaceship. What is going on?

Too many bad things for me to write.
I really wish I'd checked its rating and reviews before watching, it's a borefest. Pick something else.

Within 60 seconds it's clear this is below par for a soap opera on tv never mind a movie with Bruce Willis . Watch this and everything you watch from now on will be better than for it! It looks like I had a go at making a movie.

I am baffled... Why was this film made. Its so odd, the acting is questionable and the plot... I can only assume the actors were drunk when they agreed to do this film. On the plus side if you watch after a few drinks it becomes a comedy. Really Bruce, I'm not sad. I'm just disappointed.

review_title: Let's take all sci-fi movies and combine them!
review_detailed_main:
Could have been a fantastic idea, but it wasn't. Good actors, okay effects (mostly)

But the story takes the movie to below average in my opinion. However on a rainy november afternoon it's an okay way to waste some time.

Is Bruce chased by tax collectors or by a former wife for unpaid maintenance? A long time ago "The Last Boy Scout" has been called the poorest Bruce Willis film. Compared with "Cosmic Sin" (his last film) and "Breach" it's a masterpiece. Don't waste your money, better send them to my account. Don't bother yourself to watch, better take a walk with your dog.

People are in future. People must take ship to save something. People get possessed by aliens. People must kill possessed people. All the while, Bruce is standing around collecting a paycheck for basically doing nothing.

Bruce Willis has become the next Steven Seagal. Pretty soon even Bruce's voice will be dubbed over. He has become a Hollywood embarrassment.

A cheap Alien rip off that is awful in almost every department. An uninspired, derivative script, dull direction, clunky design, terrible make-up and effects, the whole thing screams amateur hour. Sadly it's not a so bad it's good situation, more so bad it's boring. What on earth Bruce Willis & Thomas Jane are doing in this is beyond me? I guess that's where the budget went. Avoid at all costs, just go and watch Alien again instead.

review_title: Not the worst movie I've ever watched.
review_detailed_main:
So let me get this straight, Earth is dying, and launches a last-ditch effort to colonize "New Earth".

They recruit a dysfunctional mess of psychopaths, alcoholics, smokers, and stowaways. (No offense to smokers, but you wouldn't make the cut any more than I would).

I made it to the end of the movie. That's the best thing I can say about it.

It is difficult to imagine how this movie could be worse. They obviously spent half their budget on Bruce Willis and that wasn't the best of choices. The story wasn't good. The movie desperately needed some decent special effects, but they spent all that money on Bruce Willis. Watch something else.

Finally, however, there is a piece of crap movie with a rating that is appropriate. So they even diverted the funds, normally used to buy a decent rating, to pay Bruce Willis. And maybe that was a good strategy. You see Bruce Willis' name on a movie and assume he can't need money bad enough to "act" in a movie this awful. WRONG. His financial manager probably has the best insight into why Bruce agreed to be in this stinker.

Oh dear, I will never get this time back. Poor movie, I mean really? This movie makes Zardoz look like Citizen Kane. To be fair, the highlight was watching the actors shaking their plastic rifles and seeing the post effect muzzle flash superimposed into the movie. A laugh riot.

This movie is so bad it has to be going for the cult classic agenda. The acting, the effects, the script, the science, and truly everything about this film is just horrible. I will give you an example. "I am going to give you exactly 10 seconds to come clean. FIVE, FOUR, "

review_title: Did Bruce Willis lose a bet?
review_detailed_main:
That's really the only explanation for why such an actor is featured in such a fetid piece of film-making refuse such as Breach. The storyline is more overused than the least attractive girl on the high school cheerleading squad. The dialogue is more tired than a narcoleptic hooker after fleet week. The special effects make MS Paint look like a Cray supercomputer. The science is less accurate than a myopic sniper with a tremor disorder. And the ending? The ending made me want to write an angry letter to the filmmakers' parents berating them for encouraging their kids' "creative" side instead of directing them toward their true calling as the mop-up guys at the happy ending massage parlor.

Spare yourself. Get out now, before you stain your neurons with this steaming pile of regurgitated plotline.

review_title: Far right writing with far right actors
review_detailed_main:
Seriously, I expected the lazy acting, cheap set, and a bad script.

But this is not just a dumb B-movie. This piece of garbage is God Is Not Dead level bad writing. Far-Right writing quality written all over it.

It didn't even made me sad. It made me angry.

review_title: Boring like looking at paint dry
review_detailed_main: Bad script, bad effects (I usually don't mind bad effects if the story is worth it). Bruce obviously does not give a "lump of compost". Is interprétation is dryer than usual with less emotions than a tombstone. Don't waste your time.
